data.query: Can I take loan twice in one cycle?
data.solution: Currently payday loan can be availed only once in a cycle. Example, customer has a pre-approved Kotak PayDay loan for Rs 40,000. Out of which he/she has availed a loan of Rs 30,000 on 10th December which along with interest is to be fully repaid on 5th January. Till the full due amount is paid off on 5th January, customer will not be able to avail any more payday loan.

data.query: Will this loan be reported to the credit bureaus [CIBIL TU,Experian, CRIF Highmark, Equifax]?
data.solution: Yes. Each loan and its repayment will be reported to all the credit bureaus.

data.query: Can I re-avail the loan in future?
data.solution: If the last availed payday loan is repaid in full on due date and if the customer fulfills all credit criterion as per Bank, customer can re-avail the loan in future, subject to availability of the offer.

data.query: What is Payday loan?
data.solution: Payday Loan is a term loan, offered for one month, pre-approved at 50% of your net salary, and offered to salary account holders of Kotak. No paperwork required and instant disbursal.

data.query: What is the maximum loan amount to avail?
data.solution: Rs. 1.5lac is maximum loan amount to avail.

data.query: What is the minimum loan amount to avail?
data.solution: Rs.3000/- is the minimum amount to avail.

data.query: Can this be applied offline? Is this product available at branches?
data.solution: Payday Loan is available on offer basis to salary account customers of Kotak Bank which can be availed only through Mobile Banking , Netbanking, SMS & Email communication sent through bank

data.query: What is the interest rate charged?
data.solution: Currently the rate of interest is 10% per annum.

data.query: Is there any processing fees?
data.solution: Yes. There is a fixed processing fees basis the loan amount.

data.query: Are there any Late fees or Overdue charges on non-repayment on due date?
data.solution: Yes.  Late payment fee of Rs. 300 plus tax is applicable and Overdue charge at 2% per month is applicable on the total amount due for repayment.

data.query: What is the total repayment amount due & tenure?
data.solution: The total of principal loan amount plus the interest charged until due date will be the total repayment amount due, which has to be paid in single installment as per the repayment date mentioned with loan details.

data.query: When do I Repay my loan?
data.solution: It is a single installment loan and repayable on the date mentioned with your loan details.

data.query: What will happen if the amount is not paid on due date?
data.solution: If the single installment due is not paid(recovered) on time, lien(hold) will be marked on account till amount due is recovered.

data.query: How can I repay my payday loan?
data.solution: Once the loan is availed, the total repayment amount will be deducted automatically on the due date from your Kotak Savings account (Salary Account).

data.query: Who is eligible to apply for a tractor loan?
data.solution:
All owners or cultivators of farmland and commercial operators are eligible for tractor loan.
There is no minimum land holding criteria for the loan.

data.query: What is the repayment tenure and EMI frequency of a tractor loan?
data.solution:
Repayment tenure of a tractor loan is 60 months/5 years.
EMI frequency is decided based on the repayment capacity of the customer, which can be monthly/quarterly/half yearly.

data.query: Is it required to mortgage land to get a tractor loan?
data.solution: No, it is not necessary to mortgage land for availing tractor loan.

data.query: Is it necessary to have a guarantor while applying for tractor loan?
data.solution: Guarantor is not required.

data.query: Is it necessary to have a co borrower while applying for tractor loan?
data.solution: Co Borrower is required.

data.query: What are the documents required to apply for tractor loan?
data.solution:
Duly filled in application form.
Latest passport size photos.
KYC (Identity proof and Address proof).
Land Documents.
Loan Statements in case of existing loans.

data.query: What is the minimum and maximum margin requirements?
data.solution: Margin is the difference between tractor price and loan amount, it is up to the applicant to choose the margin option depending on his financial and personal needs.

data.query: How long does it take to process and sanction a tractor loan?
data.solution: A tractor loan is sanctioned within max. 3 working days subject to completion of documents by applicant.

data.query: What is the total loan amount that can be availed for a tractor loan?
data.solution: Loan amount up to 90% of the total price of the tractor depending on the financial and personal needs of the applicant.

data.query: Can I foreclose or prepay tractor loan?
data.solution: Repayment of the loan is not allowed for 6 months, after 6 months foreclosure of tractor loan is allowed, with charges as mentioned on the schedule page of the loan agreement.

data.query: How do I approach Kotak Mahindra bank for a tractor loan?
data.solution:
Apply online
Call us at our 24 Customer Care Centre – 1800 209 5600. (9am – 6pm)
Visit our nearest branch.
Contact any of our Relationship Managers.

data.query: Why take a commercial vehicle from Kotak bank?
data.solution: Kotak Mahindra Bank is one of the pioneers in commercial vehicle loans, over the years we have developed expertise of providing customized solutions to our customers with speedy processing, transparent dealings & competitive pricing.

data.query: What is the repayment tenure & how do I repay my commercial loan?
data.solution:
Repayment Tenure of the loan may vary from 12 to 60 months, depending upon the nature of the deal and the repayment capacity. 
Repayment can be made through post-dated cheques (PDCs) / ECS or through Auto-Debit (in the case of Kotak Bank account holders)

data.query: Can I foreclose or prepay my commercial vehicle loan?

Proof of Address

data.query: How do I approach Kotak bank for a commercial vehicle loan?

data.query: What are the ornaments or coins that I can pledge for gold loan?
data.solution:
Only wearable gold ornaments from 18 to 22 karat and only bank minted coins (24 Karat) upto 50 gms per customer can be pledged. 
Items such as hair pins, cufflinks, gold watches, gold strap, gold idols, gold utensils cannot be accepted, jewelry not more than 50% deduction, thread mangalsutra, white gold, diamond jewelry, imitation jewelry, ginni, gold bars cannot be accepted.

data.query: Do I need to be an existing customer of the bank to take gold loan?
data.solution:
For availing  Kotak Gold Loan you need not be a Kotak customer, however, you need to be an Indian Citizen more than 18 years and less than 75 years. 
Please note:

1. CIBIL Rating should not be less than 450. 

2. One should not be a defaulter with any other bank.

data.query: What are the different gold loan tenures available?
data.solution:
Gold Loan facility is available under 3 schemes: 
1. Bullet Scheme: The tenure is for 12 Months (can be renewed for more 24 Months with the same document along with a request letter etc.). Interest Payment can be quarterly /Half yearly and Yearly. 

2. Vanilla Scheme: The tenure is for 36 months. No renewal is required during the tenure with monthly interest. 

3. EMI Scheme: The tenure is for 12,24,36,48 months. 

4. Over Draft facility is temporary withdrawn, kindly contact the Branch for further details.

data.query: How much gold loan amount can I avail?
data.solution:
Minimum Loan amount: Rs. 20,000/- 
 Maximum Loan Amount: Rs. 150 Lakhs and maximum 5 loans, can be availed by a single customer/Family/Group at any point of time including loan under consideration, together not exceeding maximum loan amount as specified above

 Please note: 
 1. The loan amount depends on the valuation of Gold ornaments examined by the valuer. 

2. Loan eligibility for the customer is 67 to 75% of valuation amount depending on repayment module, for e.g. Monthly Interest in EMI/Vanilla is 75 % of the value of Gold, where as it varies from 67 % to 72 % based on quarterly /half yearly interest payment. 

 3. Value of Gold is arrived by the bank as per RBI norms with factoring price fluctuations as per Bank’s Risk Model.

data.query: Do I need a guarantor to avail the gold loan?
data.solution:
While availing a Kotak Gold Loan, No Guarantor is required. If age of the borrower is between 70 to 75years, a Co Borrower is required. 
Please note: 

1. The same is not eligible even with guarantor, if the borrowers age is above 75 years. 
2. Nominee is Mandatory.

data.query: What are the different modes of disbursement for gold loan?
data.solution:
Loan disbursement can be processed by way of - 

 1.Fund Transfer (to customer's existing Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. account)
 2.Cash Disbursement up to Rs.50,000/- 
 3.As an exception ,NEFT & RTGS (to customer's other bank account)at the request of the customer ,subject to change as per Income Tax / RBI and Bank guidelines from time to time,

data.query: Can I avail overdraft facility for my business needs on gold loan?
data.solution: The overdraft facility is temporary withdrawn, please contact the Branch for further details.

data.query: How to apply for gold loan?
data.solution:
Applying for a Gold loan from Kotak is simple. To apply for the same, please follow the below steps: 
On Mobile Banking 

1. Go to Apply Now 
2. Gold Loan 
3. Apply Now 

On Net Banking 

1. Go to Loan 
2. Gold Loan
3. Apply Now
Just fill out your personal details in the form that appears after clicking. 
Please Note: 

1. Once the form the filled, you would be contacted by the bank officials. 
2. For existing gold loan customers,  please contact the concerned relationship officers / Branch. 
3. In order to visit and meet the Gold Loan Officer of any Branch, one should carry along,  the ornaments which need to be pledged along with the necessary KYC evidences , Stamp paper and revenue stamp along with 3 passport size colour photos and provide necessary details to the officer.

data.query: How long does it take to process Gold Loan?
data.solution:
Please note: 
1. Gold loan can be sanctioned in 90 to 120 mins approx. in general from end to end, if KYC and 3 colour photos are available. There could be delay, if the customer has to get the KYC documents, photos, etc. 
2. Opening of a savings bank account may take some time,  if new to the bank. 

3. Valuation of gold will be done by empaneled assayer, who would arrive at the branch on call within 15 min, once pricing is arrived for the deal. 

4. Customer has to be present till the gold packet is sealed in the presence of Assayer and branch officials.

data.query: Who can apply for a gold loan?
data.solution:
For availing Kotak Gold Loan you need not be a Kotak customer, however, you need to be an Indian Citizen more than 18 years and less than 75 years having a KYC of Officially Valid DOcument(OVD) for identity and address proof apart from signature proof. If the age group is between 70 to 75 years, then a co-applicant is required.

 Please note: 
 1. CIBIL Rating should not be less than 450. 
 2. One should not be a defaulter or having NPA with any other bank. 
 3. Gold Jewelers and Pawn brokers are not eligible.
 4. If student, he/she should submit necessary proof of cash flow to support repay the loan (Generally not encouraged)

Competitive rate of interest and Competitive Fees and charges. 

Kotak gold loan provides a scheme for the tenure of 3 years where no renewal is required every year.

data.query: Can I request gold loan in someone else's name?
data.solution:
No, the customer who visits the branch along with his/her ornaments can only avail the gold loan in his name, no third party loan other than customer can be disbursed. 
Please note: NRI customers cannot avail a gold loan.

data.query: What are the things that people should keep in mind while taking a gold loan?
data.solution:
The things that people should keep in mind while taking a gold loan are as follows: 
1. To pledge ornaments owned by the customer. 

2. Should not pledge ornaments of suspicious nature. 
3. Should not pledge ornaments below 18 K gold. 
4. Diamonds studded ornaments should not be pledged. 
5. Part release of ornaments is not possible. 
6. Full payment of gold loan is a must for secure release of ornaments. 
Please note: 

1. If defaulted, the bank has the right to charge penal on overdue amount. 
2. If defaulted, the bank has the right to auction the gold, subject to terms and conditions. 
3. Rate of interest charges and LTV is prerogative of bank rights.

data.query: How to get a no due certificate for gold loan?
data.solution:
After closing the loan, a request needs to be given for the required No dues certificate and the Branch will share the same.
If NDC is sought after one year, the bank may charge a certain amount to issue the same. 

For further details please click here.

data.query: I do not have a decent credit score can I still get a gold loan?
data.solution: Yes, if the score is 450 and above, subject to fulfilment of other criteria, -1, -2, 0 , 1 ,2 ,3 are eligible for a gold loan with prior approval internally.

data.query: Do I need to provide any income documents for gold loan?
data.solution:
Along with fulfilling the eligibility criteria, minimal documentation is required for the gold loan to get approved. You need to show a valid ID proof , address proof with 3 latest Passport size colour photos  as the basic gold loan documentation prerequisites. 
ITR needs to be submitted,  if availing gold loan of Rs. 25 lakh and above.

data.query: Which all documents do I need to provide to avail the gold loan?

data.query: Is it necessary to have a co applicant while applying for a gold loan?
data.solution:
Yes, if the borrowers age is between 70 to 75 years. 
Not eligible for more than 75 years age. 
Co- applicant requires KYC documents along with photograph. 
Only blood relatives can be the co-applicant and nominee.

data.query: What are the documents for kotak customers to apply for gold loan?
data.solution: One needs to provide KYC documents, which include identity, address & signature proof, if there is any change (otherwise not required) - along with 3 passport size photographs and necessary stamp paper and 3 revenue stamps.

data.query: What are the documents for non kotak customers to apply for gold loan?
data.solution: One needs to provide KYC documents (Aadhar card option) which include identity, address & signature proof along with 3 passport size photographs and necessary stamp papers and 3 revenue stamps. Opening of Current Account or Saving Account with the Bank is recommended.

data.query: Can I avail EMI facility on gold loan?
data.solution:
Yes. You can avail the EMI Facility on Gold Loan with the Maximum tenure of 48 months. 

 Please note: 

 1. Loan to be repaid in equated monthly instalments (EMI) with principle and interest. 

 2. Minimum lock in period of 6 to 12 months , otherwise it attracts Pre closure charges. 

 3. Top Up can be availed on EMI loan at Bank's discretion

data.query: Can I foreclose the gold loan earlier?
data.solution:
If the loan is closed within the locking period, preclosure charges will be applicable to the extent of 2.25 % + GST. 
Locking period is for minimum 6 months,  however negotiable, depending upon the need. 
One should visit the branch to pre close the account, after paying the foreclosure charges as applicable.

data.query: How can the pledged gold against the loan be reclaimed?
data.solution: One has to pay the complete outstanding amount, to ensure that there are no other dues with the bank, produce the sanction letter, Assayer Certificate, Acknowledgement for having received of Gold ornaments in good condition and Identity proof to the concerned official officer in order to release the ornaments.

data.query: How to preclose the gold loan?
data.solution:
If the loan is closed within the locking period, preclosure charges will be applicable to the extent of 2.25 % + GST. 
Locking period is for minimum 6 months,  however negotiable, depending upon the need. 

One should visit the branch to pre close the account, after paying the foreclosure charges as applicable. 

To know the exact charges for the same, please click here.

data.query: What are the additional fees that I will need to pay at the time of taking a loan?
data.solution:
Fees and Charges vary from scheme to scheme and loan amount. Basic charges applicable for gold loan will be,  Stamp duty charges ,processing fees and valuer charges. 
Please note: 

1. Stamp duty charges will be applicable as per the respective state stamp act. 

2. Processing fee ranges from 0 to 1% depending upon the quantity and loan amount, subject to deviation. 

3. Valuer charges range from Rs. 250 to Maximum Rs. 1000, depending upon the loan amount ( 2nd valuation will be done if loan amount is Rs 4 lacs and above ). 

To know more details on the fees and charges, please click here.

data.query: Are there any foreclosure charges on a gold loan?
data.solution:
If the loan is closed before the locking period, preclosure charges will be applicable to the extent of 2.25 % + GST. 
Locking period is for minimum 6 months, however,  negotiable depending upon the need. 

One should visit the branch to pre close the account, after paying the foreclosure charges as applicable.

data.query: What are the fees and charges on gold loan?
data.solution:
Fees and Charges varies from scheme to scheme and loan amount. Basic charges applicable for gold loan will be,  Stamp duty charges ,processing fees and valuer charges. 
Please note: 

1. Stamp duty charges will be applicable as per the respective state stamp act. 

2. Processing fee ranges from 0 to 1% depending upon the quantity and loan amount, subject to deviation. 
3. Valuer charges range from Rs. 250 to Maximum Rs. 1000, depending upon the loan amount ( 2nd valuation will be done if loan amount is Rs 4 lacs and above ). 
If the loan is closed within the locking period, preclosure charges will be applicable to the extent of 2.25 %. Locking period is for minimum 6 months however,  negotiable depending upon the need. If defaulted for any amount 3% penal rate will be levied. 

If interest defaulted for 3 months,  legal charges will be attracted. All fees attract GST charges as per norms.

data.query: What are the processing fees for gold loan?
data.solution:
Fees and Charges varies from scheme to scheme and loan amount. Basic charges will be applicable on the processing fee for gold loan. 
Processing fee ranges from 0 to 1% depending upon the quantity and loan amount, subject to deviation.

data.query: I have found a discrepancy in the returned gold what to do?
data.solution:
At the time of Gold loan closure, customer needs to verify the gold weight, gold count and gold condition along with appraisal certificate provided to him. 
Once the customer acknowledges the receipts of the ornaments in proper condition and taken out from the bank premises, bank is not responsible for any damages. 

If any ornaments are found damaged at the time of release of ornaments, the customer can register his protest and get the necessary solution from the bank. 

Any damage to the ornament or missing of stones etc. will be mentioned in the assayer certificate at the time of funding.

data.query: Is there a possibility of damage to the ornaments at the time of appraising?
data.solution:
No, there is no possibility of damage of ornaments at the time of Appraising as the Valuer appraises the gold in front of the customer with 100% transparency.
Even the gold packet will be sealed in front of the customer after doing the gold testing. 

Gold packets will be handled by Authorized persons of the bank only and are kept in safe custody.

data.query: What is the rate of interest applicable on gold loan?
data.solution:
To for details of interest rate click here.
It is always better to know the interest rate that you need to pay at the time of availing loan / are paying on your loan, as it helps you plan your finances better.

data.query: How is the rate of interest calculated on gold loan?
data.solution:
Fixed rate of interest, Monthly Compounding interest on Principle amount on reducing basis,  INTEREST/PRINCIPLE/EMI,  is dependent on the amount of your loan and its tenure. 
In case of EMI loans, it is important to remember, the monthly instalment that has to be paid by you,  tends to reduce,  as the term of repayment increases, it means the longer the tenure is, the lesser is the INTEREST/PRINCIPLE/EMI, that has to be paid every month. 

If any amount is defaulted, penalty of 3% on overdue amount will be imposed.

data.query: What is the repayment tenure of a gold loan?
data.solution:
Kotak offers easy repayments with multiple modes. It would either be monthly, quarterly or half yearly, depending upon the term chosen, ie: 
1. Bullet Scheme: Tenure 12 Months (Can be renewed for more 24 Months with the same document with request letter etc.). 

2. Vanilla  Scheme: Tenure 36 months ( no renewal required during the tenure with monthly Interest ). 

3. EMI Scheme: The tenure is 12,24,36,48 months. 

4. Over Draft facility is temporary withdrawn, kindly contact the Branch for further details.

data.query: What medium should I use to repay the gold loan?
data.solution:
You can repay the gold loan by the following modes of payment: 
1. Standing Instruction should be  set with help of branch officials. 

2. Cash - up to 50k allowed, beyond that, would need form 60 or PAN. 
3. RTGS /NEFT. 
4. Payment can be done through CASA accounts. 
5. Though cash payments can be made from any branch, the bank prefers customer to pay from base branch. 
6. Cheque / Pay order / demand draft will be accepted from base branch.

data.query: What is the penalty for delay in repayment of gold loan?
data.solution: If any amount is defaulted, a penalty of 3% on the overdue amount will be imposed.

data.query: Can I repay the loan partially?
data.solution:
You can choose to foreclose your loan any time after 6 months of taking the loan. Prior to the locking period, you have to pay applicable foreclosure charges. 
Pre-payment can be made in consultation with the Gold loan officer, not more than 25% of the loan amount with the tenure, and after completing the locking period. However, no partial release,  even after part payment.

data.query: How should the gold loan be repaid?
data.solution:
You can repay the gold loan by the following modes of payment: 
1. Standing Instruction should be  set with help of branch officials.

2. Cash - up to 50k allowed, beyond that, would need form 60 or PAN. 
3. RTGS /NEFT. 
4. Payment can be done through CASA accounts. 
5. Though cash payments can be made from any branch, the bank prefers customer to pay from base branch. 
6. Cheque / Pay order / demand draft will be accepted from base branch.

data.query: Is the gold pledged with banks safe?
data.solution: Gold B26:B47 packets are kept in joint custodians of the bank similar to that of cash and other securities. Gold Packets will be handled safely and swiftly every time by Bank Officials.

data.query: What security is required against the Gold Loan?
data.solution:
Only wearable gold ornaments from 18 to 22 karat and only bank minted coins (24 Karat) upto 50 gms per customer can be pledged. 


Items such as hair pins, cufflinks, gold watches, gold strap, gold idols, gold utensils , jewelry more than 50% deduction, thread mangalsutra, white gold, diamond jewelry, imitation jewelry, ginni, gold bars cannot be accepted.

data.query: What if the gold is stolen from your branch?
data.solution:
Please note: 
1. Gold packets are kept in joint custodians of the bank similar to that of cash and other securities. Gold Packets will be handled safely and swiftly every time by Bank Officials. 

2. Gold Ornaments are kept in the locker room ( vault /strong room ,double Lock ). 

3. Branch Premises are always under CCTV Surveillance 24*7. 

4. Insurance cover is done for the securities kept inside by the bank.

data.query: What is the assurance that the gold returned is the same?
data.solution:
While processing the loan, the customer is provided with a sanction letter and appraisal certificate, where in which gold photo along with Gold ornament details such as number of ornaments, gross weight are mentioned. 
When the customer visits the branch for closure of the gold loan, he has to carry the documents provided and cross verify the ornament details,  based on the details mentioned in appraisal certificate. 

Gold packets are kept in joint custodians of the bank similar to that of cash and other securities. 

Gold packets will be handled safely and swiftly every time by authorized officials only.

data.query: Which tests are done on the gold to apply for the loan?
data.solution: Bank Valuer conducts necessary Basic gold tests like acid test, salt test, sound test, rub test without damaging the ornament and wherever needed or doubtful, deep cut test with the permission of customer to be conducted.

data.query: I am unable to understand the process, please guide me through it.
data.solution: Click here to check the step by step guide to activate Kotak Mobile Banking App on your device

data.query: How do I start using Kotak Mobile Banking App?
data.solution: Download "Kotak - 811 & Mobile Banking" app from Google playstore / Apple Appstore. Launch the app and tap on ‘Click here to Log in’. Follow the step by step instructions displayed on your screen to verify your mobile number and login to the app.

data.query: What all do I need to start using Kotak Mobile Banking app?
data.solution: You will need a mobile phone with the sim of your bank registered mobile number and your Mobile Banking PIN. If you don’t have your Mobile Banking PIN, you will need one of the below: Credit Card, Debit Card, Net Banking details, Loan details (Loan only customer), Personal details (811 customers)

data.query: Is the SIM of my bank registered mobile number mandatory for activating a new device?
data.solution: If you have the sim of your bank registered mobile number, you can activate the mobile banking app yourself. You can even activate a second device as long as you have the first device handy. If your first device it is not available, we have also allowed an exception process where you can activate the app by visiting your nearest branch or calling our customer contact centre

data.query: What is a secure SMS?
data.solution: It is an encrypted SMS generated by Kotak app to verify your mobile number with the Bank records.

data.query: How is the secure SMS sent? Do I have to send it or will Kotak App send it?
data.solution: In case of Android devices, Kotak App will send the secure SMS automatically. If you are using an iOS device (iPhone), Kotak App will generate the SMS & open the messages app on your iPhone. You have to send the pre- filled SMS within 5 seconds. Please ensure not to change the text of the SMS.

data.query: Will there be any charge for Secure SMS?
data.solution: Yes, standard SMS charges will be applicable basis your service provider

data.query: I am using a dual sim phone, what do I have to do?
data.solution: Secure SMS has to be sent from the bank registered mobile number. Kotak App will show a pop-up for dual sim phones. You should select the correct slot which has your bank registered mobile number.

data.query: Will my mobile number be verified, if my phone is in Flight/Airplane mode?
data.solution: No, your mobile number cannot be verified while in Flight/Airplane mode. Please switch off the Flight/Airplane mode and try again.

data.query: I have selected wrong SIM card in my dual SIM phone while sending secure SMS, What will happen?
data.solution: Secure SMS has to be sent from the bank registered mobile number. Please try again and ensure you select the correct slot which has your bank registered mobile number.

data.query: What do I need to do if I am changing my mobile phone?
data.solution:
Please follow below process to avoid any inconvenience:

 If you are not planning to use your old phone, please uninstall Kotak Mobile Banking app from your old phone
 Insert the SIM of your bank registered mobile number in the new mobile phone
Download Kotak App from Google Play Store/ Apple Appstore
Send a secure SMS to verify your mobile number
On successful verification of mobile number, please select CRN & enter your MPIN to activate Kotak App

data.query: I am getting multiple CRNs after successful verification of my mobile number, what should I do?
data.solution: If you are getting multiple CRNs after mobile number verification, please check if all the CRNs are related to you. If you see any CRN which doesn’t belong to you, please inform us immediately through branch or contact centre.

data.query: I have multiple CRNs registered against my CRN, how do I activate all my CRNs on same Kotak App?
data.solution:
After successful Mobile number verification, you will get a list of CRNs please select the CRN you want to proceed with. If you want to add another CRN, you need to click on ‘ADD CRN’ and repeat the process.
Please note: Maximum number of CRNs which can be added on Kotak Mobile Banking App is limited to 5.

data.query: I did not try to activate Kotak app but still received SMS/email alerts, what should I do?
data.solution: Please report fraud on Kotak.com/fraud immediately or call our contact centre

data.query: Someone claiming to be from Kotak Mahindra Bank called me and asked me to forward one SMS to a mobile number provided, what should I do?
data.solution: Kotak Mahindra Bank will never call you to forward any SMS/activate any device or share any details related to your account. Please do not share any information related to your account with anyone. Please report fraud on Kotak.com/fraud immediately or call our contact centre

Once the request is initiated, please walk in to the nearest Kotak Mahindra Bank branch or call our contact centre.”

Please try again after 15 minutes of performing the above activity.

If you are still facing the issue in activating the Kotak App, please Switch network to 3G/2G from 4G before activating Kotak Mobile App & try again.

In case your mobile banking is not activated despite doing all above activities, we request you to select the option ‘No, I don’t have my registered SIM in this phone’ & tap on ‘Activate through branch or phone banking’ to create an activation request. Once the request is initiated, please walk in to the nearest Kotak Mahindra Bank branch or call our contact centre.”

data.query: I am unable to understand the process, please guide me through it.
data.solution: Click here to check the step by step guide to activate Kotak Mobile Banking App on your device

data.query: I don’t have my registered SIM with me, how can I activate Kotak Mobile Banking App on my phone?
data.solution:
In you do not have access to your registered mobile number, please follow below process to activate:

Download the Kotak Mobile Banking App from Google Play Store/ Apple Appstore
On Registration screen, please select ‘No I don’t have my registered SIM in this phone’
On next screen, select ‘Activate through branch or phone banking’
Enter your CRN & MPIN and submit
Now you need to either go to the nearest Kotak branch or call our customer contact centre on 18602662666 and ask to activate your device
The request initiated will be valid for hour.

data.query: Due to issue at my operator, I am not able to send Secure SMS, how do I activate Kotak Mobile Banking App on.

On next screen, select ‘Activate through branch or phone banking’
Enter your CRN & MPIN and submit
Now you need to either go to the nearest Kotak branch or call our customer contact centre and ask to activate your device

data.query: I have initiated a request to activate through branch or phone banking, what I am supposed to do now?

data.solution: After initiating the request, you are supposed to go the nearest Kotak branch or call our customer contact centre and ask to activate your device If your device is not activated yet, please re-initiate the request.

data.query: How long the request will be valid after initiation?

data.query: How do I get the Kotak Mobile Banking app?
data.solution: Download the Kotak Mobile Banking app from app.kotak.com or go to respective application stores - Apple App Store / Google Play Store . You can also SMS 'Mobile' to 9971056767 / 5676788 to receive the link on your registered mobile number.

data.query: What type of handset do I need to use the app?
data.solution: Mobile Banking App is supported on your smart phones. The app is available in iOS (version 8.0 onwards), Android (version 5.0.0 onwards) operating systems. You need to have access to internet (mobile data / Wifi) to use the app.

data.query: I have downloaded the application on my handset. Now what do I do?
data.solution:
Getting started on Kotak mobile banking app is very simple. 
(1) Click on the app icon to launch the app. Enter your CRN 
(2) Authenticate using any of the below details:

Debit/Credit card details
NetBanking details 
Personal details (For 811 customers only)
Account details (For loan only customers)

(3) Set your 6 digit Mobile Banking PIN (MPIN) 
(4) You will receive an activation code on your registered mobile number. Enter this activation code in the app to complete the registration. 
You will be logged into your account, and will be access 100+ features of the app to Bank, Pay bills, Invest, Shop and access services.

data.query: What precautions do I need to take for accessing Mobile Banking?
data.solution:
As someone rightly said "It's better to be safe than sorry", so here are some precautionary steps which you can take while banking with us: 
 
1. Memorize your MPIN and do not write it anywhere.
2. Don't disclose your MPIN to anyone, including Kotak Mahindra staffs.
3. Don't use obvious numbers like last digits of mobile number, date of birth etc as MPIN.
4. Change your MPIN at regular intervals.

data.query: Will I be charged for using the Kotak Mobile Banking app?
data.solution: No, Mobile Banking app is absolutely free. We do not charge for mobile banking services however standard internet charges are applicable as levied by your service providers.

data.query: I do not have a bank account with Kotak. I only have a credit card/Loan relationship, can I use  Kotak Mobile Banking App?
data.solution: Yes, Kotak Mobile Banking app is available for credit card & loan customers as well.

data.query: Who can use Kotak Mobile Banking?
data.solution:
Customers having Current/Savings Account, Term deposit, credit card or a loan account are eligible for mobile banking access.
The access & transaction rights are given as per following:
Individual Account

Sole Ownership Account: View and Transact
Joint Account- Single Operating Mode: View and Transact
Joint Account- Joint Operating Mode: View
Minor Account- Minor: No access
Minor Account- Guardian: View and Transact
Power of Attorney: View and Transact
 
Non- Individual Accounts*
Authorized Signatories - Single operating mode**: View and Transact
Authorized Signatories - Conditional operating Mode:  View
* Company, Society, Trust, Association, Partnership, Sole Proprietorship, HUF
** Karta of an HUF and sole proprietor will get 'View' and 'Transact' access

data.query: How secure is Kotak Mobile Banking?
data.solution: Our mobile banking platform uses secured HTTPS protocol for communication between the mobile client and the mobile server. Secure Hyper Text Transfer Protocol (HTTPS) uses HTTP, but, additionally activates Web server security, in the form of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL). This means that the communications between the client and the (host) Web server are encrypted. This is a highly secured environment to conduct your business with us. Additionally, all application related information stored in the device is also encrypted.

data.query: I am not able to use the Kotak Mobile App without updating, what should I do?
data.solution: To improve your Banking experience, we have launched a mandatory security upgrade for Kotak Mobile App. Please visit to Google Play Store/Apple Appstore & update to the latest version of Kotak Mobile banking App to enjoy seamless banking.

data.query: Every time I launch Kotak Mobile App, it is asking me to update and not allowing me to do any transactions, What should I do?
data.solution: To improve your Banking experience, we have launched a mandatory security upgrade for Kotak Mobile App. Please visit to Google Play Store/Apple Appstore & update to the latest version of Kotak Mobile banking App to enjoy seamless banking.

data.query: After updating the OS to iOS 16, I’m no longer able to use the Kotak Mobile App on my phone. Previously, it was working perfectly.
data.solution: iOS 16 is supported by the latest version of the Kotak Mobile Banking App. Please visit the iOS App Store and Update the latest version of the App to enjoy seamless banking.

If you do not use WhatsApp, you can check your CRN on the bottom left corner of your Credit/Debit card, or on the hard copy of your Account/Loan statement

data.query: I forgot my debit/credit card PIN? How to regenerate a PIN?
data.solution: Go to Service Requests section and select Debit Card requests or Credit Card requests to regenerate PIN.

data.query: How can I set / remove International usage facility from my Debit Card?
data.solution:
1) Mobile Banking

Go to Service Request
Debit Card Request
Activate/ Deactivate Debit card option.

data.query: When can I transfer funds?
data.solution:
You can transfer funds 24x7 and instantly through IMPS using IFSC and Account Number. You can also make NEFT  fund transfer from  8 AM and 7 PM from Monday to Saturday (except the second and fourth Saturday of each month). Also, RTGS is available to banks from 7 am to 6 pm on a working day.  
You can also use UPI which is avaliable 24x7. 
Disclaimer: All modes are subject to their daily limits

data.query: Do I need to remember the IFSC for making one-time fund transfer?
data.solution: You can choose the IFSC of a few selected banks from the “Select Bank” link while making a NEFT / IMPS Fund Transfer. In case your bank isnt present in the list, you can search for the same by selecting  Other banks > Search IFSC

data.query: My MPIN is locked. What should I do?
data.solution: Your MPIN gets locked when you enter it wrong 3 times consecutively. To unlock, use “Forgot MPIN” option on the More menu. Alternately, the MPIN will get unlocked automatically after 12 hours.

data.query: I have forgotten my MPIN. What do I do?
data.solution: Don't worry,you can use the Forgot MPIN feature on the app to generate a new MPIN. You can also reset your MPIN using your Net Banking password or Debit / Credit Card details.

data.query: How do I change my MPIN?
data.solution: Login using current MPIN & after succesful login, go to More menu & click on 'Change MPIN'. Enter your old MPIN, enter new MPIN & Confirm new MPIN to change.

data.query: What are the best practices for selecting an MPIN?
data.solution:
It's upto you on what MPIN do you want to set, but we would advice you to: 
1. Never use your DOB, Vehicle number, first or last digits of your mobile number.
2. Use an MPIN which is easy for you to remember & complicated to guess by fraudster. 
3. Change the MPIN frequently.
4. In case of any suspicious activity change it immediately.

data.query: If I change my handset will I be able to access Kotak Mobile Banking again?
data.solution: Yes, in case you change your handset, you will have to install the application on your new handset and register the app in the device. Once registered, you can access your accounts from the new handset.

data.query: Is fingerprint authentication applicable for only Login or for transactions as well?
data.solution: Fingerprint authentication is applicable for Login and select features / transactions.

data.query: Which transactions / features will still require MPIN authentication in case I login using fingerprint authentication?
data.solution:
For the following financial transactions, you will be prompted for MPIN.
Banking - Transfer Money, UPI, Scan n Pay, IMPS fund transfer

Bill Pay and Recharge - Pay Bills, recharge mobile & DTH, subscriptions, donations etc.
KayMall – all KayMall services
Credit Card - Balance Transfer, Regenerate PIN
Service Requests - Debit Card Requests - Regenerate PIN
All other features / transactions can be accessed after logging in using fingerprint authentication.

data.query: How to register for fingerprint authentication?
data.solution: If your device supports fingerprint (In Android, devices with Android 6.0 and above are allowed), you will be once prompted to allow biometric authentication at the time of  registration. In case you skip and wish to register later, you can do so from the “Fingerprint Authentication” section under “Settings”. Registration for fingerprint authentication is CRN and device specific. You will need to register separately for each CRN and on each device.

data.query: How to register for faceID authentication?
data.solution: This feature is available only for iOS devices with FaceID recognition. You will once be prompted to allow biometric authentication at the time of registration. In case you skip and wish to register later, you can do so from the FaceID Authentication” section under “Settings”. Registration for biometric authentication is CRN and device specific. You will need to register separately for each CRN and on each device.

data.query: Can I turn biometric authentication ON / OFF?
data.solution: Yes, biometric authentication can be turned ON or OFF from “Settings”, under ‘Fingerprint/FaceID Authentication’. Once turned OFF, you will be logged out of the app for security reasons, and you can continue to login using MPIN. To turn biometric authentication ON, login to the app using MPIN and go to Settings> Fingerprint/Faceid Authetication

data.query: What if I have multiple fingerprints registered on my device?
data.solution: Kotak Mobile Banking App will allow you to login with all fingerprints available on device including any fingerprint that may be added in future. For your security, please make sure you are the only person whose fingerprints are stored on the device.

data.query: Is fingerprint authentication supported on my device?
data.solution: Fingerprint authentication is supported on select android devices with android version 6.0 and higher; and on iPhone 5S and higher. In case fingerprint authentication is supported on your device, you will be once prompted to allow biometric authentication at the time of  registration. In case you skip and wish to register later, you can do so from the “Fingerprint Authentication” section under “Settings

data.query: Is FaceID authentication supported on my device?
data.solution: FaceID authentication is supported on select iOS devices. In case FaceID authentication is supported on your device,you will be once prompted to allow faceid authentication at the time of registration. In case you skip and wish to register later, you can do so from the FaceID Authentication” section under “Settings”

data.query: Will biometric authentication work in case MPIN is locked?
data.solution: No. For security reasons, login using biometric will not be enabled until MPIN is unlocked / reset.

data.query: How do I log into Net Banking?
data.solution:
On the Net Banking login page, enter the CRN/Username/Card Number. You will also get option to save your CRN on that particular system, it would get stored in cookies in an encrypted format. Once cookie is deleted, you will have to again use this option to save CRN. In case you are using your card to login, the same would not get stored in cookies even if you check the “Remember me” option. In this case, also, the CRN gets stored in an encrypted format in Cookies.
Once the CRN is saved, thereafter you will not have to enter the CRN on login page. It would be displayed on the screen in masked format. In case of different CRN, you will get an option to change the CRN. In case of multiple CRNs, you will get an option to choose the CRN to login. To log into with another CRN, you will have to select “use another account”. To remove a CRN, you will have to click on “Remove CRN” link available on the screen.
On the next screen, you have to enter the password.
The CRN will be displayed in masked form on the screen. Option to enter password using Virtual keypad is also available. Google recaptcha will be triggered if you enter incorrect password tw
In case password entered is incorrect or CRN/Card/Username is incorrect, appropriate error message will be displayed. In case the CRN does not exist OR exists but it is inactive, you would be asked to enter your mobile number and then OTP. Post that, appropriate link would be shown. If CRN is correct and it is Net Banking Active, you would be shown the password entry page.


Post-successful password entry, you will be shown a 2-step verification option (OTP / Authenticate with MB / RSA Token) based on the eligibility and the preference set.
On OTP verification screen, mobile number and email ID will be displayed in masked format.
Option is provided to ask voice OTP. The option is enabled after 30 seconds
If in More Option you select the login with Mobile Banking option, you will have to log into the Kotak Mobile Banking App, then tap on the burger menu, which is on the top left corner of the app. From there, you need to select Approve Net Banking login from the menu, then enter either MPIN or use biometric, and then finally tap on Approve.


After completing the 2-step verification, you will be logged in and taken to the Net Banking dashboard.

data.query: I have forgotten my Net Banking password. How can I regenerate it?
data.solution:
You can generate Net Banking password online by following the below mentioned steps:

Click on Need Help option on login screen and then click on “I want to generate my password”
On the next screen you will be prompted to enter the CRN/username or Card number
On the enter password screen, “Forgot Password” option is also available
You need to enter the registered mobile number
If you enter a wrong mobile number 3 times, online password regeneration would be locked for 12 hours
Only if your mobile number is registered with the bank will you be able to procee
If details match, OTP will be sent on both the registered Mobile Number and email ID. You can also request for Voice OTP
After entering correct OTP, you will be prompted to enter Debit/Credit/Forex Card details or answer Security questions whichever option is available for you
If you opt for Card authentication, below details need to be entered:
Debit / CREDIT / FOREX Card – Only numeric value should be accepted
Expiry date will be in MM/YY format
CVV- 3 digit numeric
Card Pin – 4 to 6 digit will be masked


If you select the Security Question option for authentication, you would have to answer 2 of the 4 Security Questions to validate yourself. You will be given an option to change the question.
Once the validation is successful, you will be taken to the Set new password screen where you will have to enter and re-enter the new password
Email / SMS alert will be sent to your registered email ID and mobile number on successful password change

You can generate Net Banking password online by following the below mentioned steps:

Click on Need Help option on login screen and then click on “I want to generate my password”
On the next screen you will be prompted to enter the CRN/username or Card number
On the enter password screen, “Forgot Password” option is also available
You need to enter the registered mobile number
If you enter a wrong mobile number 3 times, online password regeneration would be locked for 12 hours
Only if your mobile number is registered with the bank will you be able to procee
If details match, OTP will be sent on both the registered Mobile Number and email ID. You can also request for Voice OTP
After entering correct OTP, you will be prompted to enter Debit/Credit/Forex Card details or answer Security questions whichever option is available for you
If you opt for Card authentication, below details need to be entered:
Debit / CREDIT / FOREX Card – Only numeric value should be accepted
Expiry date will be in MM/YY format
CVV- 3 digit numeric
Card Pin – 4 to 6 digit will be masked


If you select the Security Question option for authentication, you would have to answer 2 of the 4 Security Questions to validate yourself. You will be given an option to change the question.
Once the validation is successful, you will be taken to the Set new password screen where you will have to enter and re-enter the new password

Email / SMS alert will be sent to your registered email ID and mobile number on successful password change

data.query: What is FATCA Declaration?
data.solution: FATCA stands for the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act, a legislation to help counter tax evasion in the US. FATCA enables automatic exchange of financial information between India and the US. Indian financial institutions have to provide necessary information to Indian tax authorities, which will then be transmitted to the US. FATCA Declaration is a mandatory exercise for both Individual and Non-Individual Investors. If you have been paying taxes in any country apart from India, you need to provide the tax identification number of that country also. Read more

data.query: Can I submit FATCA Declaration online through Net Banking?
data.solution: Yes, you can submit FATCA Declaration online through Net Banking if you are an Indian citizen and a tax resident of India and of no other country. Else you have to download the FATCA form and submit it to your nearest branch of Kotak Mahindra Bank.

data.query: What is NACH Cancellation request?
data.solution: NACH (National Automated Clearing House) is a funds clearing platform similar to the existing ECS (Electronic Clearing Service).  NACH Cancellation request is used to cancel automatic debit from your account every month to pay bills like telephone bills, electricity bills, installments, insurance premiums etc.

data.query: If I deregister for printed statement, how can I get statements?
data.solution: You will receive e-statements on your registered Email ID, once you deregister for printed statement. Also you can view or download statements using Net Banking, Mobile Banking and Website (Get Help section).

data.query: The request for change of Home Branch is not available for me?
data.solution: Request to change Home Branch is not available for all bank customers online. If you are unable to change your home branch, please visit the nearest Kotak Mahindra Bank branch.

data.query: Few or none of my account(s) can be upgraded using Upgrade Account Variant request?
data.solution: Only selected accounts are eligible for upgrading the account variant online. If you are unable to upgrade your account variant, please visit the nearest Kotak Mahindra Bank branch.

data.query: What are the Investments activities I can do online?
data.solution:
Following are the activities:
1. You can view your Account, Transaction Details and NAV of your investments.
2. You can purchase and redeem investments online.
3. You can check on the status of your Purchase/Redemption requests.
4. You can download reports.
5. You can get the latest NAVs and advisory services.

data.query: What is InterBank Fund Transfer?
data.solution:
InterBank Fund Transfer is a facility that allows you to transfer money from your account with Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. to an account in any other Bank, subject to the beneficiary's bank participating in the RBI National Electronic Funds Transfer (RBI - NEFT) scheme. This facility is available currently to resident Indian customers only.
You need to login using your Net Banking login ID and password, and select InterBank Fund transfer option under Payments on the left hand side menu.

You will then need to select the source account and enter the amount to be transferred and the details of the beneficiary account like beneficiary name, beneficiary account number, account type, bank name and the destination branch.


Your account will be debited online, subject to sufficient available balance. 
The time taken to credit the Beneficiary's account will be dependent on the time taken by the Beneficiary's Bank to process the payment.

If you have regenerated Net Banking password online in the last 7 days, then option to update details will not be available
The option to update Profile details online will be available for Individual & Non Individual customers (only to the Authorized Signatory)

data.query: How secure is Net Banking?
data.solution:
We have the most advanced security system to safeguard your Net Banking transactions. All your transactions travel in a 256-bit SSL encrypted medium, the highest level of security on the Internet. The servers are protected with firewalls that make unauthorized access impossible.
At the customer level, every customer is provided with a unique User ID and password. In addition, we make sure that:


To login into Kotak Net Banking, other than CRN and Net Banking Password, you need a One Time Password which is auto generated everytime you login and sent on your preferred mobile number and email ID.
In addition to the One Time Password, you can also authenticate using Kotak Mobile Banking app or use Digital Signature Certificate. You can use Digital Signature Certificate after you have registered the same on Net Banking.
You need to register and activate the beneficiary before making a fund transfer. The Beneficiary Activation Code is sent only on your preferred mobile number registered with the bank.
You can activate only 5 beneficiaries online per day and can transfer maximum Rs. 25,000 to a new beneficiary for next 24 hours after beneficiary activation.
To prevent somebody from guessing your password and getting unauthorized access to your account, your Net Banking access is locked after three consecutive wrong password entries. Similarly, to prevent somebody from guessing your One Time Password and getting unauthorized access to your account, the facility to generate One Time Password gets locked after five consecutive wrong entries of One Time Password.
To prevent an unauthorized person from viewing your Net Banking account in case you leave your computer idle, we close your Internet session in case of inactivity for an extended period of time.
If you want to block your Net Banking for a specific duration, you can call our 24-hour Customer Contact Centre and ask our Customer Care Officers to do so. You can unblock it whenever you want by calling and requesting for the same.
In case, you do not use at least any of the channels i.e. Payment Gateway, Mobile Banking or Net banking for 720 days, the same will be blocked

data.query: What are the banking activities I can do online?
data.solution:
Following are the online banking activities:
1. View your account balance, account activity, account details, un-cleared fund details, cheque status and current exchange rates.
2. Transfer funds between your accounts or third party accounts maintained with Kotak Mahindra Bank, or with any other Bank which participates in RBI NEFT / RTGS / IMPS scheme, open a Fixed / Recurring deposit, check the Fixed / Recurring Deposit rates over various tenures & amounts, set up standing instruction online to transfer funds between your own accounts, third party accounts or through Banker's Cheques.
3. e-File income tax.
4. Request for a cheque book and give stop cheques request.
5. Download account statement for the financial or calendar year, for a month or a specific period.
6. Enquire about the TDS information on your deposits for the current & previous financial year.
7. Register and view your Kotak Life Insurance policy.
8. Register and apply for National Pension System (NPS)
9. Pay all your utility and credit card bills and recharge prepaid mobile / DTH through Kotak BillPay.
10. Communicate with the bank in a secure medium through the 'Inbox' option which will allow greater flexibility for communicating with us, including the ability to put an online request for our Home Banking Services.
11. Do online Shopping on merchants' website using Kotak Net Banking credentials.

data.query: What are the charges for Net Banking?
data.solution: All Kotak Mahindra Bank customers are given free access to Net Banking.

data.query: What are the Demat activities I can do online?
data.solution:
Following are the activities:

data.query: How do I  start using WhatsApp Banking Services ?
data.solution:
For using Kotak Bank's WhatsApp Banking Services, you can either
Give us a Missed call on 9718566655 from your registered mobile number to get started. You will immediately receive a welcome message and all services related details on WhatsApp from Kotak Bank's official number 022 66006022.
OR
Start by clicking the below button.

data.query: Is WhatsApp Banking secure?
data.solution: Yes, banking on WhatsApp is safe. All messages are secured with end to end encryption. Your account information is not shared with anyone. You do not need to enter any confidential information such as PIN or password on WhatsApp.

data.query: What is Kotak Bank's Official number for WhatsApp Banking Services?
data.solution: The number 022 66006022 is the Kotak bank's offical WhatsApp number. You can save this number and start chatting

data.query: I am not able to use WhatsApp Banking ?
data.solution: We are sorry to hear that, please check if you are using a smartphone with WhatsApp enabled and SIM with mobile number registered with the bank.

data.query: What all services can I avail on WhatsApp Banking?
data.solution: You may ask information on your bank account (Balance, Last 3 transaction, Statement request, Cheque Status etc.), Credit card (Credit card application status), Debit card (Apply for new Debit card, set PIN / international usage etc.), 811 (How to change MPIN, How to fund account etc.) and update profile.

data.query: Why is OTP based registration required for WhatsApp Banking ?
data.solution: OTP based registration helps us to verify your mobile number which is registered with the bank. You will be asked to re-register via OTP after 60 days from last date of registration.

data.query: Are there any charges applicable for using WhatsApp Banking?
data.solution: No, there are no registration or service charges for using this service. However, the GPRS plan charges will be applicable as per your data plan with the telecom service provider.

data.query: Will I be able to use WhatsApp Banking services if I change my mobile number?
data.solution: Yes, you just need to update your registered mobile number in the bank as the new one. Please use Mobile banking or Netbanking for futher help.

data.query: How do I subscribe/opt-out from receiving WhatsApp notification from bank ?
data.solution: To unsubscribe, you need to type “Stop” on Whatsapp number 022 66006022 from the registered mobile number on which you want to opt-out.

data.query: How do I de-register from WhastApp Banking services for a particular mobile number ?
data.solution: You need to type “Block Whatsapp” on Whatsapp number 022 66006022 from the registered mobile number on which you want to de-register.

data.query: How can I close my Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:
To get the full benefit of your Fixed Deposit, it's always better to allow it to complete the term. But if you need to request a for Fixed / Fixed Deposit closure / Premature withdrawal, this is what needs to be done:  
 
1. On Net Banking  
a) Login to Net Banking  
b) Go to Investment > Deposit  
c) Select Premature Withdrawal of Deposit (Amount will be credited your account instantly).  
 
2. You can also place a request at the nearest Kotak Branch. (Amount will credited your account within 24-48 hours).  
Important: Penal Charge on Pre-mature withdrawal of Fixed Deposits (Domestic / NRO / NRE) with effective from 20th May, 2022
Interest will be paid at the rate prevailing on the date of deposit for the tenure the deposit or the withdrawn amount remained with the bank or at the contracted rate, whichever is lower after deducting applicable penal charge for premature withdrawal as per Terms & Conditions of the bank.
As per Terms & Conditions of Fixed Deposit Accounts of the Bank, the penal charge on premature closure of Fixed Deposits including partial closure has been fixed by the bank as below on Fixed Deposits booked/ renewed on or after 20th May, 2022. 

Tenure of Fixed Deposit

Penalty

Less than equal to 180 days

Nil

Greater than 180 days to less than or equal to 364 days

0.50%

Greater than or equal to 365 days

1.00%


 
Please note: In case of premature closure of Fixed deposit within 7 days from date of it's booked, no interest shall be paid and only principal amount will be returned.

data.query: Why am I unable to foreclose my fixed deposit?
data.solution:
This might have happened:
1. One of the possibilities is that you are trying to make a premature withdrawal of a Joint Fixed Deposit. 
2. While placing a request online, you might have selected the Fixed Deposit Account number which has been linked to some others products, like a credit card or any type of loan.
3. Your Internet Banking may have only viewing rights, because of which you are not able to place a premature withdrawal of the fixed deposit request (this is mostly in case of current accounts).
4.  The chosen deposit might be Tax Saving Deposit which has not completed the minium 60 months period.

data.query: How can I break my Recurring Deposit partially before maturity?
data.solution:
Sorry, currently a Recurring Deposit cannot be withdrawn partially.  
To get the full benefit of your Recurring Deposit, it's always better to allow it to complete the term. But if you wish too, you can withdraw it prematurely by following few simple steps:  
1. On Mobile Banking  

Go to Banking  
Select Fixed/Recurring Deposits  
Select Premature withdrawal  

OR  

2. On Net Banking  

Go to Investment -> Deposits  
Select Premature Withdrawal of Deposit  

(Amount will be credited your account instantly).  
3. Alternatively, you can also place a request at the nearest Kotak Branch. (Amount will credited your account within 24-48 hours).  

Please Note:  

1) In case of premature closure of this Deposit within a month, no interest shall be paid and only principal amount will be returned.  
2) On premature withdrawal of RD. The interest will be paid at the rate prevailing on the date of Deposit for the tenure the Deposit remained with the bank or at the contracted rate, whichever is lower post deducting penal charge of 0.5% on premature withdrawal of RD booked for tenure between 6 months to less than 12 months and 1 % for RD booked with tenure 12 months & above, effective 20th May, 2022

data.query: I want to change the maturity instruction of my Fixed Deposit how can I do that?
data.solution:
You can change maturity instruction of Term / Fixed Deposit by choosing one of these options:  
1. On Net Banking  

Go to Investment -> Deposits  
Change Maturity instruction for Fixed Deposit  

 
2. You can place this request by calling our 24x7 helpline number 1860 266 2666 (Standard call charges applicable).  
3. Alternatively, you place this request at our nearest branch as well.  

Please Note:  

1. Maturity instructions for Fixed Deposit can be changed online or on call from Redeem to Renew only and not the Renew to Redeem.  
2. On the date of maturity instruction can be not be changed online.  
3. In order to change the maturity instruction from Renew to Redeem pleas your request at our nearest branch.

data.query: I want to continue my Recurring Deposit after maturity how can I continue it?
data.solution:
I'm sorry! It is not possible to change the maturity instruction of your Recurring Deposit.  
You can, of course, continue with this good saving habit by investing in a new Recurring Deposit with a fresh value date.  
Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/Recurring-Deposits.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to explore Recurring Deposit.

data.query: How can I book a new Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:
It's great that your thinking of saving for your future!  
You can book a Term / Fixed Deposit by following a few simple steps:  
1. On Mobile Banking  
1) Go to Banking -> Fixed/Recurring Deposits  
2) Open Fixed Deposit  
2. On Net Banking  
1) Go to Investment -> Deposits   
2) Open A Fixed / Recurring Deposit  
 
Please Note:  
1) Please click here to know Fixed Deposit interest rates.  
2) Fixed Deposit can be booked with minimum amount of Rs. 5000/- and (if it's your first Fixed Deposit, the minimum amount is Rs. 10,000/-) and there is no maximum limit.  
3) For Fixed Deposits with a tenure below 181 days, interest will be calculated at maturity as Simple Interest.  
4) No interest will be payable for NRE FDs maintained for less than 1 year.  
5) In case of Tax Saving FD a) No pre-mature withdrawal of principal or accrued interest is permitted under this scheme b) Lien cannot be marked on the Fixed Deposit receipt issued under this scheme c) For Tax Saving Fixed Deposit, maximum amount is Rs. 1,50,000 and minimum tenure is 60 months.  
6) Deposits booked under Premature Withdrawal Not Allowed option cannot be withdrawn before maturity.  
Example:
a) Tax Savings Fixed Deposit
b) Applied Credit card against Fixed Deposit.

data.query: Can the first applicant for a Recurring Deposit be a minor?
data.solution: Yes, the first applicant can be a minor. Standing Instruction will be set up on the minor's account. by simply clicking here : https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/deposits/recurring-deposits/features.html

data.query: Is there any TDS on Recurring Deposit?
data.solution: Yes, TDS on Recurring Deposit would be deducted as per the income tax guidelines under Section 194A from dated 01 June 2015.  Please click here https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/deposits/recurring-deposits/recurring-deposits-faqs.html

data.query: Are there any extra benefits for senior citizens on a Recurring Deposit?
data.solution:
Yes, senior citizen customers get an additional 0.50% p.a. rate of interest over and above the interest payable to regular customers.  
You can book a Recurring Deposit by following few simple steps:  
1. On Mobile Banking  
1) Go to Banking -> Fixed/Recurring Deposits  
2) Open Fixed Deposit  

2. On Net Banking  

1) Go to Investment -> Deposits  
2) Open A Fixed / Recurring Deposit  
3) Select Recurring Deposit  

Please Note:  
1. Recurring Deposit can be opened for a minimum of Rs.100/- and for maximum of Rs.1,00,000/- in multiples of 100.  
2. Minimum tenure for Recurring Deposit is 6 month and Maximum up to 120 month (10 years), in multiple of 3 months.  
3. Interest on the Recurring Deposit is compounded at quarterly intervals, at the applicable rates.  
4. Please click here to check Recurring Deposit interest rates.

data.solution:

You can book a Recurring Deposit by following few simple steps:

2) Open Fixed Deposit  

2. On Net Banking

3) Select Recurring Deposit  
Please Note:  
1. Minimum tenure for Recurring Deposit is 6 month and Maximum up to 120 month (10 years), in multiple of 3 months.  
2. Interest on the Recurring Deposit is compounded at quarterly intervals, at the applicable rates.  
3. Please click here to check Recurring Deposit interest rates.

data.query: Is age proof required for Fixed Deposits?
data.solution:

data.query: I want to book a Fixed Deposit but my PAN is not updated can I book it?
data.solution:

You can update you PAN and post that book a Fixed Deposit, please find below ways to update your PAN. 
1. On Mobile Banking  
1) Go to Service Request -> Profile  
2) PAN Update

1) Go to Profile

data.query: How to link my Fixed Deposit to my Account?
data.solution:
You can easily link your Fixed Deposit to your saving or current account by using Net Banking:  
1) Go to Investment -> Deposits  
2) Link a Fixed Deposit to Savings / Current Account  
Another way, you can place this request by calling our 24x7 helpline number (1860 266 2666 Standard call charges apply) OR at our nearest branch.  

Please Note:  

1. In case of joint Fixed Deposit linking can't be done online.  
2. Fixed Deposit linking to your savings or current account is not possible if it's booked under Sweep In Facility or if Sweep in Facility is Active in your Savings or Current Account.  
Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/sweep-in-facility.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to know more on Sweep in Facility.

data.query: Would there be any disadvantages of booking a Fixed Deposit without updating PAN card?
data.solution:
I would recommend you to update your PAN card. If not, you will face the following disadvantages:  
1. TDS will be recovered at 20% (as against 10%)  
2. NO TDS credit from the Income Tax department  
3. NO TDS certificate will be issued (As per CBDT circular no: 03/11)  
4. Form 15G/H and other exemption certificates will be invalid and penal TDS will apply.

data.query: What is meant by maturity proceeds in a Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:
Maturity proceed is the amount which will be paid to you being investor of a Fixed / term/ Recurring Deposit on completion of the tenure of selected period.  
Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/Fixed-Deposit/Fixed-Deposit-features.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to explore Fixed Deposit.

data.query: What are the special interest rate for a Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:
We have a selected tenure for which we provide a special interest rate. If you book it for a specified period, then you will be eligible for the special interest rate.  
E.g. Interest rate on 390 Days (12 months 25 days) is 7.40% p.a.  
On above example if book a Fixed Deposit for exact 390 days you will be eligible for highest interest rate which is 7.40%p.a.  
If you book a Fixed Deposit for 389 days (less than 390 days) or for 391 days (more than 390 days) you will get less interest as compared to special interest rate.  
Please note: Tenure and rate of special interest are subject to change time to time. 

Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/Fixed-Deposit/Fixed-Deposit-interest-rate.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to check Fixed Deposit interest rates.

data.query: What is the minimum amount I can book as a Fixed Deposit?

data.query: What are the tenures for which I can book a Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:

data.query: Who all are eligible to open a fixed deposit account?
data.solution:
The list of people eligible to open a fixed deposit (FD) account with us include Indian nationals, NRIs (non-resident Indians), senior citizens, members of an HUF, and minors under guardianship. Here is how you can book a fixed / term deposit  online with us: 
1. Login to Mobile Banking 
1) Go to Banking -> Fixed/Recurring Deposits 
2) Open Fixed Deposit 
2. Login to Net Banking 
1) Go to Investment -> Deposits 
2) Open A Fixed / Recurring Deposit 
Please Note: 
1) To check Fixed Deposit interest rates, please click here.
2) FDs can be booked by vising nearest branch with a minimum amount of Rs. 5000. If this is your first FD, the minimum amount is Rs. 10,000. There is no maximum limit. 
3) For FDs with a tenure of below 181 days, interest will be calculated at maturity as simple interest. 
4) No interest will be payable for NRE FDs maintained for less than a year. 
5) In case of Tax Saving FDs:
A) No premature withdrawal of principal or accrued interest is permitted. 
B) Lien cannot be marked on the FD receipt issued under this scheme. 
C) Maximum amount is Rs. 150,000 and minimum tenure is 60 months.
 6) Deposits booked under Premature Withdrawal Not Allowed option cannot be withdrawn before maturity. For example: 
a) Tax Savings Fixed Deposit
b) Applied Credit card against Fixed deposit.

data.query: Which fixed deposit type should I choose?
data.solution:
That's nice, you're planning your investments! 
Select Recurring deposit if you want to invest monthly; select fixed deposit if you want to make lumpsum investments; fixed deposits are of two types viz., Pay out deposits or cumulative deposits. Choose pay out deposits if you need to monthly/quarterly interest in your account or select cumulative if you want interest to be clubbed with your principal and paid out at maturity You can book online a Recurring Deposit/Fixed / Term deposit by following a few simple steps: 
1. Login to Mobile Banking 
1) Go to Banking -> Fixed/Recurring Deposits 
2) Open Fixed Deposit 
2. Login to Net Banking 
1) Go to Investment -> Deposits 
2) Open A Fixed / Recurring Deposit 
Please Note: 
1) To check Fixed Deposit interest rates, please click here.
2) FDs can be booked by vising nearest branch with a minimum amount of Rs. 5000. If this is your first FD, the minimum amount is Rs. 10,000. There is no maximum limit. 
3) For FDs with a tenure of below 181 days, interest will be calculated at maturity as simple interest. 
4) No interest will be payable for NRE FDs maintained for less than a year. 
5) In case of Tax Saving FDs:
A) No premature withdrawal of principal or accrued interest is permitted. 
B) Lien cannot be marked on the FD receipt issued under this scheme. 
C) Maximum amount is Rs. 150,000 and minimum tenure is 60 months.
 6) Deposits booked under Premature Withdrawal Not Allowed option cannot be withdrawn before maturity. For example: 
a) Tax Savings Fixed Deposit
b) Applied Credit card against Fixed deposit.

data.query: How can I transfer my fixed deposit money to my savings account
data.solution:
To get the full benefit of your Fixed Deposit, it's always better to allow it to complete the term. But, if you wish to, you can transfer your fixed deposit value, fully or partially, by making a premature withdrawal, in one of the following ways:
1. On Mobile Banking 
1) Go to Banking
2) Select Fixed/ Recurring Deposits
3) Select Premature withdrawal
2. On Net Banking
1) Go to Investment -> Deposits
2) Select Premature Withdrawal of Deposit (Amount will be credited in your account instantly). Alternatively, you can also place a request at the nearest Kotak Mahindra Branch. (Amount will be credited in your account within 24-48 hours).
Please Note: 1. In case of premature closure of Fixed Deposit within 7 days from the date of its booking, no interest shall be paid and only the principal amount will be returned. 2) There will be a penalty on the interest rate (0.50%), if the FD was booked for 181 days and above, and withdrawn before maturity. Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/deposits/fixed-deposit.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to know more about the Fixed Deposits available at Kotak.

data.query: What option should I select if I want to open a long term fixed deposit?
data.solution:
If you are booking a fixed deposit for a longer period (more than 181 days), and if you do not want interest to be credited to your Savings/ Current account on a monthly/ quarterly basis, please select the deposit type - Cumulative Quarterly, where you will get interest and principal on maturity. On this long-term FD, you will be earning interest on the interest amount, for which Interest compounding will take place on a quarterly basis. Let's understand the other FD options available, as well. 
1) If the Monthly Payout option is selected, then interest will be credited to the selected Savings/ Current account on a monthly basis (FD can be booked for minimum one year and a minimum amount of Rs. 1 lakh).
2) If the Quarterly Payout option is selected, the interest will be credited to the selected Savings/ Current on a quarterly basis (FD can be booked for minimum one year). 
3) If the Tax Savings Cumulative option is selected, then both the interest and principal will be credited on maturity, which is the same as the option with an additional benefit of tax saving. (FD can be booked for minimum 5 years).
4) If the Short Term option is selected (below 181 Days), interest and principal both will be credited on maturity. There is zero penalty on premature withdrawal. 
5) If you want a Tax Saving Payout option, a tax saving fixed deposit with a quarterly interest payout option is the right choice for you. To explore and check the latest interest rates on our Fixed Deposit, please click here.

data.query: What is form 15G?
data.solution:
Form 15G is an instruction that you can give to the bank, asking that not to debit TDS on interest earned on Term / Fixed / Recurring Deposit in a particular financial year.  
it's not mandatory but it will be helpful if you submit Form 15G every financial year if you are earning interest more than INR 40000 in a financial year. How is that, let's check few examples:

 1) If your total annual income is lower than the exempted slab in income tax.  

 If you fill form 15G Tax Deducted at Source will not be debited and you can save excess tax payment (if any).  
If you do not fill form 15G Tax Deducted at Source will be debited and you need to apply for refund (if any).  

 
2. If your total annual income is more than the exempted slab in income tax.  

 If you do not fill form 15G Tax Deducted at Source will be debited and you will get TDS certificate which you can attach while filing returns and pay the remaining tax (if any).  
If you fill form 15G Tax Deducted at Source will not be debited and while filing returns, you need to attach interest certificate and pay the tax on interest earned (if any).

2. Every new financial year, a fresh form 15G Request needs to placed even though its a old term / Fixed Deposit.

Recurring Deposit (instalment) standing instruction will be debited on the same date every month. Recurring Deposit (instalment) standing instruction will be debited on the same date every month. 
You can book a Recurring Deposit by following few simple steps:

Go to Banking -> Fixed/Recurring Deposits  
Open Fixed Deposit  
2. On Net Banking  
Go to Investment -> Deposits

Select Recurring Deposit  

Please Note:

data.query: What will be the charges if I delay the Recurring Deposit installment?
data.solution:
If you delay the instalment beyond the stipulated due date + grace period of 5 days, penal interest for the entire month will be levied. The delayed penalty charge will be at the applicable Recurring Deposit rate + 2%.  
For more details on Recurring Deposit Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/Recurring-Deposits.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq

data.query: How can I change the installment due date of my Recurring Deposit?
data.solution:
I'm sorry, the Instalment Due Date (auto debit date) and Tenure of an existing Recurring Deposit cannot be changed once set.  
Please Note:  

1. If you wish to invest more amount in Recurring Deposit please book a fresh (New) one with the tenure you wish too.  
2. As the standing instruction date change option is not available for Recurring Deposit and you are in need of date change, I suggest to break the existing Recurring and book a new one on date you wish too.  
3. There will be no interest for Recurring Deposit broken within one month from the date of its booked.
