data.query: Can I make monthly payments into my fixed deposit account?
data.solution:
A Fixed Deposit has the option for a lump sum investment, at one go. If you are looking for a monthly investment, you can choose a Recurring Deposit, in which you save and invest a fixed amount on a monthly basis. You can book a Recurring Deposit by following the few simple steps below: 
 
1. On Mobile Banking
1) Go to Banking -> Fixed/ Recurring Deposits 
2) Open Fixed Deposit 
 
2.On Net Banking 
1) Go to Investments -> Deposits 
2) Open A Fixed/ Recurring Deposit 
3) Select Recurring Deposit 
 
Please Note: 
1. A Recurring Deposit can be opened for a minimum amount of Rs. 100 and for a maximum amount of Rs. 1,00,000, in multiples of Rs. 100. If monthly interest is chosen it would be at a discount as per extant guidelines of RBI.
2. The minimum tenure for a Recurring Deposit is 6 months and the maximum is 120 months (10 years), in multiples of 3 months.
3. Interest on the Recurring Deposit is compounded at quarterly intervals, at the applicable rates. 


Please click here to explore all about Recurring Deposits at Kotak.

data.query: When do I become liable for TDS (Tax Deposited at Source) for Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:
You become liable for TDS when the total interest you earn for all Deposits held under a particular customer ID is greater than Rs. 40,000/- for other than senior citizen and Rs. 50000 for senior citizen in a financial year. 
Please click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/Fixed-Deposit.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to explore Fixed Deposit

data.query: When does the bank debit TDS (Tax Deposited at Source)  on a Fixed Deposit?
data.solution:
We start debiting TDS from your interest earned on Deposits as and when it crosses INR 40000/- for other than Senior Citizen and INR 50000/- for senior citizen in a particular financial year.  
TDS is also deducted on unpaid interest accrued at the end of a financial year on 31st March.  
Example 1. Total Interest earned (including Fixed and Recurring Deposits) in a financial year Rs. 35000/- TDS will not be debited as it's not crossed threshold.  

2. Total Interest earned (including Fixed and Recurring Deposits) in a financial year Rs. 45000/- TDS will be applicable as its crossed the threshold for individual @ rate of 10% it will be INR Rs. 4500/-  
A TDS deducted during a calendar quarter, certificate will be issued in the next month of the respective quarter.  

Example TDS deducted for quarter April to June 2018 Certificate will be sent in the month of July 2018  
2. The TDS Certificates that were sent till date via post can be downloaded online from the NSDL.

data.query: Can TDS (Tax Deposited at Source) be recovered from the principal of Fixed Deposit?
data.solution: Yes, when your interest earned amount is insufficient to recover TDS, it is recovered from the principal of the Deposit.

data.query: Would any change in my Fixed Deposit portfolio affect my TDS (Tax Deposited at Source) liability?
data.solution:
Yes. If any change or enhancement in your Deposit portfolio earns a cumulative interest along with that of the earlier portfolio greater than Rs. 40,000 (for all other than senior citizen) OR Rs. 50000 (for senior citizen), you will be liable for TDS on your current portfolio.  
Click https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/Deposits/Fixed-Deposit/Fixed-Deposit-features.html?cid=answer&source=keya&medium=faq to explore Fixed Deposit.

data.query: At what rate is TDS (Tax Deposited at Source) deducted?
data.solution:
TDS rates vary. The following rates apply:  
1. TDS for Resident Individuals / HUF / Corporate Entity / Partnership Firms is 10% and in the absence of PAN, it is 20%  
2. TDS for an NRO account holder is 30.90%

data.query: How to apply for exemption on TDS (Tax Deposited at Source)?
data.solution: You can apply for exemption on TDS when your total interest income for the financial year will not fall within an overall taxable slab. You can intimate us by submitting form 15G (for other than senior citizen) and 15H (for senior citizen) instructing us not to deduct TDS on your Deposits.

data.query: How to get TDS (Tax Deposited at Source) certificate?
data.solution:
A TDS deducted during a calendar quarter, certificate will be issued in the next month of the respective quarter.  
Example: TDS deducted for quarter April to June 2018 Certificate will be sent in the month of July 2018  
Please Note  

1. The TDS Certificates that were sent till date via post can be downloaded online from the NSDL. 
2. TDS Certificate in Form 16A starting from financial year 2010-11.

data.query: What is exit load in mutual fund?
data.solution:
A Load Fund charges a percentage of NAV for entry or exit into the fund. The load structure of a scheme has to be disclosed in its offer documents. In accordance with the SEBI circular SEBI/IMD/CIR No.4/168230/09 dated 30 June 2009 there is no entry load for any/all mutual fund schemes. 
 
A no-load fund is one that does not charge entry or exit load. It means the investors can enter the fund/scheme at NAV and no additional charges are payable on purchase or sale of units. 
 
Exit load is generally charged if the exit is made before a specified time. In most equity funds, the exit load is 1% if the exit is before 1 year. Assuming you bought the fund at a NAV of Rs.10, and after 6 months the NAV is Rs.11 and you wish to exit from the fund, you will be charged 1% of 11 = 0.11 and your redemption proceeds would be Rs.10.89 (Rs.11- Rs.0.11). 
 
Currently, in India, the exit load charged is credited to the scheme. Investors should consider loads while making investments as these affect their returns. However, investors should also consider the performance track-record of accomplishment and service standards.

data.solution:

A Load Fund charges a percentage of NAV for entry or exit into the fund. The load structure of a scheme has to be disclosed in its offer documents. In accordance with the SEBI circular SEBI/IMD/CIR No.4/168230/09 dated 30 June 2009, there is no entry load for any/all mutual fund schemes. 
 
Exit load is generally charged if the exit is made before a specified time. In most equity funds, the exit load is 1% if the exit is before 1 year. Assuming you bought the fund at a NAV of Rs.10, and after 6 months the NAV is Rs.11 and you wish to exit from the fund, you will be charged 1% of 11 = 0.11 and your redemption proceeds would be Rs.10.89 (Rs.11- Rs.0.11).

data.query: What is expense ratio in mutual fund?
data.solution: Expense ratio is the cost of running and managing a mutual fund, which is charged to the scheme. The expense ratio represents the annual fund-operating expenses of a scheme and other charges, expressed as a percentage of the fund's average daily net assets. Operating expenses of a scheme include administration, management, and advertising related expenses.

data.query: How to get KYC verified for mutual funds investment?
data.solution:
Know Your Client (KYC) registration is mandatory for all investor as per SEBI guidelines. KYC is being centralized through KYC Registration Agencies (KRAs) that are registered with SEBI. 
 
With this, each investor has to undergo the KYC process only once in the securities market and the KRAs share details with other intermediaries.

data.query: Who needs to do KYC for investing in mutual funds?
data.solution:
Short answer - everyone. Currently, all investors (Individuals or Non-Individuals) who want to invest in a mutual fund scheme, irrespective of the amount, are required to complete the KYC process. This also applies to any new Systematic Investment Plan (SIP). 
 
Please visit your nearest Kotak Branch to complete your KYC.

data.query: What are the KYC requirements for Mutual Fund Investor?
data.solution:
Mutual fund Individual Investors will have to produce the following documents: 
 
1. Proof of identity (Photo PAN card copy, or PAN card copy and copy of the passport, driving license, etc.) 
 
2. Proof of address (any of the valid documents listed in the KYC Application Form for Individuals). 
 
Non-Individual Investors will have to produce certain documents pertaining to constitution/registration to fulfil the KYC process. A list of Mandatory Certified Documents can be found in the KYC Application Form for Non-Individual Investors.

data.query: What is NAV (Net Asset Value) in mutual fund?
data.solution:
In simple terms, net asset value or NAV is the market value of the securities held by a particular mutual fund scheme. NAV is the market value per unit of all the securities that a particular fund holds. The NAV of the scheme shows its performance. 
 
Mutual funds invest money collected from investors into the securities markets. Since the market value of securities changes every day, the NAV of a scheme also varies on a day-to-day basis. It is mandatory for mutual funds to disclose its NAVs regularly. 
 
The NAV per unit is the total market value of securities of a scheme minus any liabilities (or expenses),  this is then divided by the total number of units of the scheme on any particular date. For example, if the total market value of securities of a mutual fund scheme is Rs. 210 lakh, its liabilities are Rs. 10 lakh, and the mutual fund has issued 10 lakh units to investors, its NAV per unit will be Rs. 20 ie ; Rs 210 lakh minus Rs 10 lakh divided by 10 lakh units.

data.query: What is Purchase price Purchase NAV in mutual fund?
data.solution: The purchase price or purchase NAV is the price at which investors buy the unit of a scheme. Units are allotted to customers on the basis of the amount invested divided by the NAV on the investment date.

data.query: What is repurchase redemption NAV in mutual fund?
data.solution: Repurchase or redemption NAV is the price at which investors sell the unit minus any load, if applicable. An exit load is chargeable as a percentage of the NAV if the investment is redeemed before the exit load period ends.

data.query: What is an Investment Horizon in mutual fund?
data.solution:
An Investment Horizon refers to the length of time that investors are willing to hold their portfolios. Investment horizons can be classified as: 
 
1. Short term: These are investments with a short horizon of 3 months to 2 years. With these, money can be accumulated for a particular objective in a short period. For example, to create a reserve fund for unexpected spending. 
 
2. Medium term: Investment with a medium-term horizon of 2-5 years. This is good for monetary needs that could arise in a few years. 
 
3. Long term: Investments with longer-term horizons of 5 years or more. This could be used after retirement, or for children to study, and other longer-term goals.

data.query: How to open a mutual fund investment account with Kotak bank?
data.solution:
To invest in mutual funds, you need an Investment Account. Once you have that, you can start placing orders to buy and sell mutual funds through net-banking services offered by Kotak Bank. 
To invest in mutual funds via net-banking, please follow the steps below: 

1. Login to Net-banking with your Customer ID and password 
2. Go to Investments 
3. Click on the Transact Tab 
4. Select Purchase Tab

data.query: What is Growth Option in mutual fund
data.solution:
If an investor chooses the growth plan of a mutual fund, the fund will reinvest any gains that the investor makes in that fund back in to the fund, that is, it does not offer any pay-outs. 
Profits made on the portfolio are necessarily ploughed back into the scheme. 

These growth plans are considered continuous compounders of wealth.

data.query: What is dividend payout option in mutual fund?
data.solution: If an investor chooses the dividend payout plan of a mutual fund, a portion of the return/fund is paid out periodically to the investor. The NAV of a dividend fund faces a drop in value to the extent of the dividend paid out.

data.query: What is Dividend Reinvestment option in mutual fund?
data.solution: In a dividend reinvestment plan, the mutual fund buys units to the extent of the dividend declared by the fund at the post-dividend NAV and credits units to the account. This results in an increase in the number of units.

data.query: What are sector specific mutual funds?
data.solution:
Sector-specific mutual funds/schemes invest in the securities of only those sectors or industries that are specified in their offer documents, such as pharmaceuticals, software, fast moving consumer goods (FMCG), petroleum, information technology (IT), or Banks. 
 
The returns in these funds depend on the performance of the sectors/industries that the funds invest in. 
 
While these funds may give higher returns, they are more risky compared with diversified funds, since they focus on specific sectors.

data.query: What are the different types of mutual fund schemes?
data.solution: A mutual fund scheme can be classified as an open-ended scheme or a close-ended scheme depending on its maturity period.

data.query: What is an open-ended mutual fund scheme?
data.solution:
An open-ended fund or scheme is one that is available for subscription and repurchase on a continuous basis. 
 
These schemes do not have a pre-defined maturity period. Investors can conveniently buy and sell units of such as scheme at their Net Asset Value (NAV) per unit, which is declared on a daily basis. 
 
The key feature of open-end schemes is liquidity.

data.query: What is a close ended mutual fund scheme?
data.solution:
A close-ended fund or scheme has a stipulated maturity period, typically 3-5 years. The fund is open for subscription only during a specified period at the time of its launch. 
 
People can invest in these schemes during their new fund offers and can subsequently buy or sell units of such schemes on the stock exchanges where the units are listed. However, liquidity for such schemes in the secondary market may be very low. 
 
In order to provide an exit route to investors, some close-ended funds give an option of selling back the units to the mutual fund through periodic repurchases at NAV-related prices. 
 
SEBI regulations stipulate that at least one of the two exit routes is provided to investor repurchase facility, or listing on stock exchanges.

data.query: What is Equity Scheme in mutual fund?
data.solution: An equity scheme invests predominantly in equities, i.e; the shares of companies. Its primary objective is wealth creation or capital appreciation. It has have the potential to generate higher return and is best for long-term investment.

data.query: What is Debt Scheme in mutual fund?
data.solution:
Debt mutual funds mainly invest in a mix of debt or fixed-income securities such as treasury bills, government securities, corporate bonds, money market instruments, or other debt securities with different time horizons. 
 
Generally, debt securities have a fixed maturity date and pay a fixed rate of interest. 
 
The returns from such funds is attributed to interest income and capital appreciation/depreciation in value due to changes in interest rates and market dynamics.

data.query: What is Hybrid Scheme in mutual fund?
data.solution:
Funds that invest in a mix of assets are known as hybrid funds. These funds can invest into equity, debt, and/or gold. 
 
The most popular of such funds choose to invest in a mix of equity and debt. Their asset allocation is mentioned in their offer documents. 
 
These funds are appropriate for investors looking for moderate growth. They generally invest 40% - 60% in equity and debt instruments.

data.query: What is Gilt Funds in mutual fund?
data.solution: Gilt funds invest exclusively in government securities. Government securities have no default risk. NAVs of these schemes also fluctuate due to changes in interest rates and other economic factors, just like they do for income or debt-oriented schemes.

data.query: What is Index Funds in mutual fund?
data.solution:
Index funds replicate the portfolio of a particular index such as the BSE Sensitive Index (Sensex) or the NSE 50 Index (Nifty). These schemes invest in securities in the same weightage of an index. 
 
NAVs of such schemes rise or fall in line with the rise or fall in the index, though not exactly by the same percentage due to some factors known as 'tracking errors' in technical terms. 
 
Necessary disclosures for such schemes are available in their offer documents.

data.query: What is Money Market in mutual funds?
data.solution:
Money market schemes are those that invest in liquid instruments with an aim to provide easy liquidity, preservation of capital, and moderate income. 
 
These schemes invest exclusively in short-term instruments such as treasury bills, certificates of deposit, commercial paper and inter-bank call money, and government securities. 
 
These funds are appropriate for investors who want to park their surplus funds for short periods.

data.query: What is Liquid Schemes in mutual funds?
data.solution:
Liquid schemes are those that invest in liquid instruments with an aim to provide easy liquidity, preservation of capital, and moderate income. 
 
These schemes invest exclusively in short-term instruments such as treasury bills, certificates of deposit, commercial paper and inter-bank call money, and government securities. 
 
These funds are appropriate for investors who want to park their surplus funds for short periods.

data.query: Can joint holder apply in sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: Of course you can! Joint holding is allowed. However, Maximum limit for subscription is 4 kgs for individuals per fiscal year(April-March).In case of joint holding, the investment limit of 4 kgs will be applied to the first applicant only.

data.query: Can I apply sovereign gold bonds account for my child?
data.solution: Yes, you can. But the application on behalf of a minor has to be made by the guardian through the branch. The Guardian to submit SGB application form along with copy of PAN.

data.query: How do I apply for Sovereign Gold bonds?
data.solution:
Here are some of the ways to apply for Sovereign Gold Bonds (SGBs): 
 
1. Login to Mobile Banking - Go to Banking – SGB
2. Login to Net Banking - Go to More – ASBA - Apply for Sovereign Bonds
3. Customer Contact Center– 1860-266-2666
4.  Visit your nearest Kotak branch.

data.query: Can I apply for sovereign gold bonds if I don't have demat account?
data.solution:
Yes, you can also apply for Sovereign Gold Bonds in the physical form. You should opt for bond delivery type as Physical during the application. 
Please note: Incase of physical form/ certificate, the bonds will be held in the RBI's books and the same will be mailed to your registered email id.

data.query: I need my holding certificate for sovereign gold bonds , when will i get it?
data.solution: The holding certificate for Sovereign Gold Bonds will be mailed to your registered email ID incase you have opted for physical form else it will reflect in your demat account on the date of issuance of SGB.  You can collect the 'Certificate of Holding' from your nearest Kotak branch if you do not have an email ID.

data.query: Can I apply for sovereign gold bonds in demat form?
data.solution: Yes, you can hold Sovereign Gold Bonds in your demat account (Kotak or Non Kotak). You should make a specific request for this in your application form itself.

data.query: Can I trade sovereign gold bonds on my demat account?
data.solution: Sovereign Gold Bonds are listed on the stock exchanges and one can trade in them if they are held in demat accounts.The bonds can also be sold and transferred as per the provisions of the Government Securities Act, 2006.

data.query: What documents are needed to purchase sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: No additional document is needed for a full KYC account to apply for Sovereign Gold Bonds (SGBs).  Incase, customers falling into other category (HUF/Minor ) of investors may however approach any nearest branch and fill-up the application form along with the PAN copy to apply for the SGB series.

data.query: What is the maximum limit for investment in sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: The Sovereign Gold Bonds or SGBs are issued in denominations of 1-gram gold and in multiples thereof. Minimum investment in SGBs is 1 gram with a maximum subscription limit of 4 kg for individuals, 4 kg for a Hindu Undivided Family (HUF), and 20 kg for trusts and similar entities per fiscal year April-March (as notified by the government periodically).(Each member of your family can buy the Sovereign Gold Bond up to 4kg in his/her own name if he/she meets the eligibility )

data.query: I want to know that , what is the price of sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: The nominal value of Sovereign Gold Bonds will be in Indian rupees, fixed on the basis of the simple average closing price of gold (999 purity, published by the India Bullion and Jewellers' Association Limited) for the last three business days of the week preceding the subscription period

data.query: What will I get on maturity of sovereign gold bond?
data.solution: At the time maturity, customer will get the maturity proceed in their saving account. The redemption price shall be based on the simple average closing price of gold (999 purity, published by the India Bullion and Jewellers' Association Limited) for the previous three business days from the date of repayment.

data.query: what is the tenor of the sgb bond?
data.solution: The tenor of the Bond will be for a period of 8 years, with exit option after 5th year to be exercised on the interest payment dates

data.query: can I gift /transfer sovereign gold bonds to my relative?
data.solution: Sovereign Gold Bonds can be gifted, and are transferable to a relative, friend, or anybody who fulfils the eligibility criteria. Please note  - Bonds shall be transferable by execution of an Instrument of transfer in accordance with the provisions of the Government Securities Act and Regulations.

data.query: When can I start trading a sovereign gold bonds after investing in it?
data.solution: Bonds will be tradable on stock exchanges within a fortnight of the issuance on a date as notified by the RBI.

data.query: Is nomination facility available on sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: Yes, nomination facility is available on Sovereign Gold Bonds as per the provisions of the Government Securities Act, 2006, and the Government Securities Regulations, 2007. A nomination form is only available when you apply for a physical bond delivery type. If it's demat, your demat nominee will automatically be considered.

data.query: What is Sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution:
Sovereign Gold Bonds are government securities issued by Reserve Bank of India on behalf of the Government of India and earn an assured interest rate eliminating risk and cost of storage. 
 
Advantages of Sovereign Gold Bonds:

Superior alternative to holding gold in physical form.
Risks and costs of storage are eliminated. Investors are assured of the market value of gold at the time of maturity and periodical interest.
No issues like making charges and purity in the case of gold in jewellery form.
Held in the books of the RBI or in demat form eliminating risk of loss of scrip etc

data.query: Who issues sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: Sovereign Gold Bonds are issued by the Reserve Bank of India on behalf of the Government of India.

data.query: Why should I buy sovereign gold bonds rather than physical gold or what are the benefits to invest in SGB?
data.solution: The SGB offers a superior alternative to holding gold in physical form.The risks and costs related to storage are eliminated through SGBs. Investors are assured of the market value of gold at the time of maturity and periodical interest. The quantity of gold that you buy through SGBs is protected. You receive the ongoing market price when you redeem it or even on premature redemption.  SGBs are free from issues such as making charges and purity that crop up in the case of owning gold jewellery.  These bonds are held in the books of the RBI or in demat form, eliminating risks such as loss of scrip.

data.query: Wanted to know the eligibility to invest in sovereign gold bonds?
data.solution: The bonds will be restricted for sale to resident Indian entities including individuals, HUFs, Trusts and Charitable institutions. For online application through Kotak Bank, the bonds are for sale to only ‘individuals’ through the Net Banking, Mobile Banking and Phone Bankinng. Customers falling into other category (HUF/Minor ) of investors may however approach the any nearest branch and fill-up the application form along with the PAN copy to apply for the SGB series.

data.query: what is the minimum and maximum amount to be invest in SGB?
data.solution:
Minimum permissible investment will be 1 gram of gold.
Maximum limit of subscription shall be of 4 kg for individuals, 4 kg for Hindu Undivided Family (HUF) and 20 kg for trusts and similar entities notified by the government from time to time.

data.query: What are benefits of applying online?
data.solution: If you apply through Digital mode  - like Mobile Banking or Net banking then you can get a discount of Rs 50/-  per gm(units) as notified by RBI.

data.query: What is the rate of interest that sovereign gold bonds bear?
data.solution: The investors will be paid at the rate of  2.5%  on the amount of initial investment notified by RBI and is payable semi-annually. Interest on Sovereign Gold Bonds will be taxable as per the provisions of the Income-tax Act, 1961 (43 of 1961).

data.query: Is SGB Tax exempted at maturity?
data.solution: The capital gains tax arising on redemption of SGB to only an individual has been exempted. The indexation benefits will be provided to long term capital gains arising to any person on transfer of bond.

data.query: Can I avail a loan against sovereign gold bonds that I hold?
data.solution: Yes, these securities can be used as collateral for loans from banks, financial institutions, and Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs).The loan-to-value ratio will be the same as one that is applicable to ordinary gold loans prescribed by the RBI periodically. Granting loan against SGBs would be subject to decision of the bank/financing agency, and cannot be inferred as a matter of right.

data.query: Will I receive a premium receipt every time I make a payment?
data.solution: You will be issued a receipt each time you make a payment. For ECS / SI cases, receipt is issued only after confirmation of a successful transaction.

data.query: What is reduced paid up?
data.solution: If the policyholder does not want to continue paying premiums but wants the cover to continue, then he can opt for the paid-up option whereby the sum assured is reduced and the future premiums are not payable. However, the policyholder will lose the rider benefits if he opts for the Reduced Paid-up option. Pure risk policies i.e. Term/Preferred term plans cannot be made paid-up.

data.query: What is Waiver of Premiums benefit?
data.solution: In the unfortunate case that you become totally disabled, this add-on benefit waives off all future premiums - both on the basic cover and on all add-on benefits during the disability period. All benefits of the original insurance plan would remain valid until maturity, without your being required to continue to pay the premiums for the base policy or the add-ons.

data.query: If due to any reason, I am unable to pay the premiums on my policy before the due date what is the time period available for paying my premiums?
data.solution: If the premiums are not paid due to any reason, the policy goes into lapse and the customer loses the life cover. He can revive the policy without undergoing any formalities by paying the premiums within 6 months from the due date. If he pays after six months, then he needs to complete major revival formalities and may even have to undergo medicals. However the maximum time period available to revive the policy is 2 years from PTD and for policies, which have been issued after 01.09.2010 two years from the discontinuance date. If the premiums are not paid for more than 2 years from the due date, then policy will terminate and payout if any shall be paid. In case of NON UL plans, the policy might move into Reduce Paid Up mode. Please refer to your policy document for further information.

data.query: What are the different premium paying options available?
data.solution:
Nearly all policies provide yearly, half yearly, quarterly, and monthly modes of premium payment. 
In addition, some plans also have the option to pay the premiums only for a limited period of time and not for the full policy term.

data.query: What will happen to my policy if I miss a premium payment due date?
data.solution:
The maturity values are product specific. Please refer to individual product pages for exact details. 
Kotak Life Insurance offers a grace period of 30 days after the premium payment due date for paying the outstanding premium. If you fail to pay the premium on your policy within this grace period your policy will lapse. You can revive your lapsed policy by paying your outstanding premium and late payment charges. This facility is available for six months. However, you can still revive the policy within revival period as per respective plans. But if you are applying for revival of your policy in this period, then shall entail submission of proof of good health. For plan specific conditions, please refer respective Plan’s terms and conditions for more details.

data.query: What is a claim?
data.solution: A claim is a rightful demand, for payment in accordance with an insurance policy claim, by way of a formal request to an insurance company asking for a payment based on the terms of the insurance policy by a rightful nominee to the claim.

data.query: Who can intimate a claim?
data.solution:
The policyholder or the nominee (as mentioned in the Policy Contract) can intimate a claim. 
1. If nominee is minor, appointee, as mentioned in the Policy Contract, can intimate a claim on behalf of the minor nominee. 
2. In case of unfortunate event of the contractual parties, claim can be intimated by the legal heir with proof of legal title.  
3. In case of multiple nominees in policies, what documents are to be submitted? Multiple 
 
Nominees – Single Policy: 
In case of more than one nominee in a policy, all the nominees will have to fill in separate Claim Intimation Form along with all requisite documents. Multiple copies of documents pertaining to affected person need not be submitted. 
Multiple Nominees – Multiple Policies: 

In case of multiple nominees in multiple policies of the affected person, all the nominees will have to fill in separate Claim Intimation Form along with all requisite documents. Multiple copies of documents pertaining to affected person need not be submitted. 
Can a claim be lodged in branch other than one from where policy was purchased? 

A claim can be lodged in any branch of Kotak Life Insurance, irrespective of the branch from where policy was purchased.

data.query: What would be the procedure in case of demise of proposer (if different from life insured) where waiver of premium rider is not opted in policy?
data.solution: Policy where waiver of premium rider is not opted and proposer (if different from life insured) dies; policy needs to be continued by paying future premiums. In such claims; with respect to the policy terms and conditions; the request for policy owner change with requisite documents can be submitted at our nearest branch

data.query: Whose KYC documents are to be submitted under the following instances?
data.solution:
1. KYC documents  to be submitted under Death Claim: 
a. Nominee is Minor: Incase where nominee is minor, the appointee as per the Policy Contract intimates the claim and KYC documents of appointee are to be submitted with claim intimation. 

b. Absence of Nomination: KYC documents of the legal heir are to be submitted with claim intimation. 

c. Death of Nominee / Appointee: KYC documents of the legal heir / legal guardian are to be submitted with claim intimation. 

2. KYC documents  to be submitted under Rider Claim: Latest KYC documents of the life insured are to be submitted with the claim intimation.

data.query: What will be the amount of benefit that would be payable on death of Life Insured?
data.solution: Death benefits vary as per the plan opted by the policyholder. The detail of benefit payable on the death of Life Insured is readily available in the policy contract issued by Kotak Life Insurance under section Benefits payable - “Death Benefit” entails the benefit payable.

data.query: Can claim benefit amount be received in any other currency other than Indian Currency?
data.solution: Death benefit amount will be paid only in Indian Rupees.

data.query: Can claim amount received as death benefit be repatriated outside India?
data.solution: For all policies including those under Non-Residence Indian Insurance Scheme, claim amount cannot be repatriated out of India.

data.query: If after applying for the policy, life insured gets to know about health conditions which were not mentioned in the proposal form will the claim be settled?
data.solution: It's a duty of life insured to inform the company about health changes happening after proposal signing and before issuance of policy. If life insured fails in his duties in informing the life insurance company, death claim would be processed after considering all the facts w.r.t. health conditions of the life insured.

data.query: If death is due to terrorist attack/war/natural calamities will the claim be settled?
data.solution: Death due to terrorist attack/war/natural calamities is covered under life insurance policies (unless specifically excluded in policy contract) and claim is settled if all the documentation are in order and all the conditions are fulfilled. In such scenarios we have fast track claim processing to provide quick aid for the sudden loss.

data.query: What is average time taken to settle the claim intimated to us?
data.solution: Claims are normally settled within 7 to 15 days from the date of receipt of all the requisite documents. In few cases, claim might be internally verified by us. However, even in these cases, claims will be settled within a maximum period of 120 days from the date of intimation of claim to Kotak Life Insurance Claims Department.

data.query: Who is eligible to receive claim benefit in absence of nomination/unfortunate demise of nominee?
data.solution: In absence of nomination/unfortunate demise of nominee, the legal heir is entitled to receive the claim benefits on submitting proof of legal title i.e. succession certificate, guardianship certificate along with other requisite claim documents.

data.query: If beneficiary is not satisfied with the service provided by Kotak Life Insurance at claims stage or with the amount of benefit paid to whom he can refer the case?
data.solution:
Kotak Life Insurance has internal ombudsman (Grievance Redressal Committee). Beneficiary can write to Kotak Life Insurance claims department and Claims department would put the matter before internal ombudsman for resolution. The decision taken by internal ombudsman would be communicated to the beneficiary. Beneficiary can also get in touch with Life Insurance Ombudsman (list of Ombudsman is available with Kotak Life Insurance and can be provided on request). 
Claims under unusual events: 

Missing Person 
Any person, whose whereabouts are unknown whatever be the circumstances or causes of disappearance would fall under this category. Such person/s shall be considered as "MISSING" until located and their well-being or otherwise being duly established. In the normal process of life insurance claim settlement, filing an insurance claim without a death certificate can create problems. In this connection, we shall follow provisions of Sec. 108 of the Indian Evidence.
Act and a Supreme Court ruling, which are as under: 
Provisions of Section 108 of The Indian Evidence Act, 1872: 
Burden of proving that person is alive who has not been heard of for seven years: 
Provided that when the question is whether a man is alive or dead, and it is proved that he has not been heard of for seven years by those who would naturally have heard of him if he had been alive, the burden of proving that he is alive is shifted to the person who affirms it.The Supreme Court Ruling is based on the provisions of Section-108 and states that "The presumption as to death in the absence of any evidence would arise only on lapse of seven (7) years". In other words, it would mean that a missing person is not presumed dead until he or she has been missing for seven years. Thus the presumption of death of the Life Insured shall be taken into account only on completion of 7 years from the date of the person having gone missing. Moreover, this has to be by way of an order from a competent authority/court. The date of order of such authority/court shall be considered as the date of death. 
Unforeseen Circumstances / Natural Calamities: 
The company shall look at cases of natural disasters or one-off major incidences like Tsunami, Mumbai Floods, 9-11 attacks etc., on an exception basis. We shall make basic checks/enquiries to ensure that there are no mal-practices, invalid claims are not being incorrectly honored by the Company or benefits are not unfairly/wrongly paid to third persons, not fairly eligible for the claims against the interests of the Policyholders at large. Based on these sanity checks, the company shall waive certain documentation to ensure a smooth claims process for the benefit of the Policyholders at large. 
Based on a Death Certificate issued by the Municipal Authorities or equivalent or based on a typical statistics/gazette issued by the State/Central Govt., claims can be processed on the presumption that the Life Insured has expired, irrespective of other documentation. 
An indemnity may be collected from the nominee in each case. 
In all cases, we would need complete documentary evidence of the relationship of the nominee/legal heir.

data.query: Is there any policy where I can receive money during the tenure of the policy?
data.solution:
Yes, the Money Back Policies. This is an anticipated endowment policy with an additional feature of receiving a benefit at regular intervals during the tenure of the policy. The risk cover continues for the entire policy term in spite of the installments already paid. If you outlive the policy, the maturity benefit along with accumulated bonus is paid back to you. For example, Kotak Premier Money Back Plan. 
This is suitable for you if you plan to coincide the receipt of funds from the policy with your future anticipated needs like a car, an overseas holiday, children's educational needs, marriage expenses, etc.

data.query: Can I switch between different investment funds?
data.solution: Shifting of investment from one investment fund to another is called switching. You can switch across all funds offered by the insurance company in any desired proportion.

data.query: I have lost/misplaced my policy docket? What should I do now?
data.solution: You must intimate the nearest Kotak Life Insurance branches immediately through a letter along with an indemnity on Rs. 200 stamp paper and Rs. 500 (plus ST and Edu cess) towards administrative charges (stamp duty paid for registration). In case the stamp duty for a particular policy amounts to more than the administrative charges collected (Rs. 500), you will need to pay an amount based on the actual stamp duty.

data.query: What is maturity date?
data.solution: The date on which the contract of insurance policy comes to an end and on which the survival benefits are payable.

data.query: What is free look period?
data.solution: In case you wish to reconsider your decision to hold the policy, you have the option of returning the original policy to us, within 15 days from the date of receipt of the policy.

data.query: Is free look period available on all policies?
data.solution: Yes, free look period is available on all policies

data.query: Can I surrender my policy before maturity?
data.solution: You can surrender your policy before maturity. Post payout of the Surrender Value, the policy gets terminated. A policy acquires Surrender Value and payout of the surrender value will be dependent on the specific product category & features.

data.query: What is a unit-link policy?
data.solution: A unit-link policy allows you to determine the risk you can undertake and then invest in funds accordingly. You are allowed to determine what proportion of the premium will be invested in which fund. Units are generally of face value of Rs. 10 and each unit is a fraction of the total fund.

data.query: Is there any limit on the number of switches in a policy year?
data.solution: No, there are no limits on the number of fund switches that you are allowed in a year. However there are number of free switches which are dependent on the plan opted by the policyholder. Please refer to your policy document for number of free switches allowed in a year or charges applicable for the same.

data.query: What is Automatic Cover Maintenance?
data.solution: If the policyholder has paid the premium for the last 3 years, and if he discontinues paying premium after three years, the policyholder goes into Automatic Cover Maintenance. Under this provision, the customer’s basic life cover will be available and in the event of death, the full death benefit will be payable to the customer. The customer’s fund will be utilised for paying the mortality charges. Once the fund is completely exhausted the policy will terminate. However, this feature is not available in pure risk plans i.e. Kotak Term, Kotak Preferred Term plan.

data.query: Are there any advantages in buying insurance at an early age?
data.solution: Yes. The premium that you pay on your insurance policy is mainly dependent on two things - your age and the tenure of the policy. The younger you are, the lower is your insurance premium amount. At younger age, you would be physically sound and may not be suffering from illnesses/ medical condition. This would entitle you to a lower premium on the policy. Therefore it is advisable to buy insurance at an early age to reduce the cost of insurance.

data.query: What are riders?
data.solution:
Riders are additional benefits that can be attached onto your basic life insurance policy. These riders give you the benefit of increasing your risk cover in case of certain events happening. For instance, if you have taken an Accident Death Benefit rider and you die due to an accident then your beneficiaries can get up to a maximum of twice the basic sum assured subject to Claims acceptance. 
Similarly there are different riders addressing different contingencies like Critical Illness, Permanent Disability Benefit, etc. There are riders available that waive your future premiums in case of death or disability of the proposer. 
These riders come at a nominal cost and can be availed of depending on the policy taken. These can be taken at the beginning of the policy term or during the policy term. Riders offered by Kotak Life Insurance are Accidental Death Benefit, Permanent Disability Benefit, Critical Illness Benefit, Term Benefit, Kotak Life Guardian Benefit, and Kotak Accidental Disability Guardian Benefit.

data.query: If the original Policy Contract was lost and request for issuance of duplicate was not made, will the claim be processed without Policy Contract?
data.solution: Policy Contract is a mandatory document for claim processing. In case where original Policy Contract is not available, claimant has to provide notarized affidavit-cum-indemnity on the stamp paper. Format of affidavit-cum-indemnity for claim can be availed under FORMS section, any nearest Kotak Life Insurance branch or from Claims department at HO.

data.query: Can future premiums be deposited into different investment funds without shifting existing investments in any investment fund?
data.solution: You can redirect future premiums into any investment fund in any proportion without shifting existing investments in any investment fund.

data.query: Why is there a difference between the NAV declared on the Kotak website and the NAV applied to my transaction of the same day?
data.solution: The NAV declared on the Kotak website is the pure NAV without taking into account the charges incurred. The NAV applied to the transaction is the actual NAV declared after determining the net effect of all the transactions in the fund and taking into account the charges for the transaction.

data.query: What is transfer or assignment of a life insurance policy?
data.solution: Transfer or assignment is a method of transferring of all benefits and rights under a life insurance policy to another person or institution including as security for repayment of loans.

data.query: Is assignment of a policy allowed?
data.solution: Yes, assignment of policy is allowed. To assign the policy, the policyholder has to notify the company. Assignment has the effect of nullifying the nomination in the policy. Assignment is not permitted in case of retirement plans.

data.query: How to make an assignment or transfer of a life insurance policy?
data.solution: Assignment or transfer of a life insurance policy may be made by simply making an endorsement to that effect in the policy document. Another way of transferring or assigning the life insurance policy is by getting a separate assignment deed executed. The former case is a preferred mode of assignment as it is exempt from further stamp duty. An assignment should be signed by the assigner or his duly authorised agent specifically stating the fact of transfer or assignment and attested by at least one witness. An assignment form needs to be filled and signed by the policy owner, assignee and a witness.

data.query: Do I need to submit my policy document with my assignment form? Why do I need to submit my policy?
data.solution: Yes, you will need to submit your original policy document along with your assignment form. The assignment is endorsed on your policy document and then sent to the assignee and assigner is intimated

data.query: Is assignment permitted on all insurance plans?
data.solution: Yes assignment is permitted on all policies except policies, which are purchased under Married Women's Property Act (MWP) and pension plans.

data.query: What is the difference between nomination and assignment?
data.solution: While the nomination is an authorisation to receive the policy money in the event of the death of the life assured, it does not give the nominee an absolute right over the money received to the exclusion of other legal heirs. Further, the nomination can be revoked or cancelled at any time during the lifetime of the policyholder at his will and pleasure or by a subsequent assignment. On the other hand, assignment of an insurance policy is a transfer or assignment of all rights and liabilities to the insurance policy in favour of the assignee. The policyholder cannot revoke an assignment once made.

data.query: What are the important details required to be submitted if I wish to change or add another nominee?
data.solution:
The details required are:
1. Name of the nominee
2. Address.
3. Date of Birth.
4. Percentage of share of the nominee

data.query: What tax benefits are you eligible for if you make a lump sum injection / Top-Up?
data.solution: The regular premium paid by the policyholder is eligible for tax deduction under Section 80C (subject to conditions specified) of the Income Tax Act, 1961. Also, benefits paid under the life insurance policy are exempt from tax under Section 10 (10) (D) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, subject to the conditions specified in section 10 (10) (D).

data.query: Is there any option where I can restrict my premium payment for a lesser number of years than the duration of the policy?
data.solution: Yes. With the Kotak Classic Endowment Plan, there is a Limited Premium Payment (LPP) option. Under this option you can take a policy for 15 to 30 years and opt for paying premiums term of either 7 years for 15 years policy term or policy term less 5 years. This option is suitable for people who are sure of secured income only for a specified period of their earning life during which they want to pay off all their premiums.

data.query: What is lump sum injection / Top-Up contribution?
data.solution: You have an option to contribute additional amounts over and above the regular premium payable under the unit linked life insurance plan. These Top-Ups/injections do not alter the original sum assured under the policy. However, Top-Up amount allows you to increase your investment and savings at your own pace

data.query: What is the minimum and maximum limit on Lump Sum Injection/Top Up premium applicable for ULIP Plans?
data.solution: Minimum and maximum limit on injection shall depend on the plan opted by the policyholder. Please refer to your policy document for minimum and maximum top up eligibility applicable under your plan.

data.query: Is loan available in unit-linked plan?
data.solution: For products launched under new guidelines from October 2013 onwards loans are not allowed. Please refer to your policy document for further information.

data.query: What is the percentage of loan I can get on a policy and what is the rate of interest applicable for traditional plans?
data.solution: Availability of the loan would differ for different plans subject to product-wise eligibility. Interest rate is charged at 12.5% p.a. compounded half yearly

data.query: What is FASTag?
data.solution: FASTag is a device that uses Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) technology for making toll payments directly from a prepaid account linked to it. It is affixed on the windscreen of a vehicle. It enables user to drive through toll plazas without stopping for cash transactions. FASTag has a validity of 5 years and needs to be Recharged / Top-up as per transaction requirement.

data.query: Which all Toll Plazas accept FASTag?
data.solution:
FASTag is presently operational at 1000+ toll plazas across national highways, select state highways and parking plazas. More toll plazas will be brought under the FASTag program in the future.

You can see the list of plazas

data.query: Why FASTag is mandatory if some toll plazas still don't have separate FASTag lane?
data.solution: It is digital initiative of Govt. of India where all the National Highway toll plazas are mandated to have FASTag lane. In case any plaza is not having the FASTag lane or not accepting payments via FASTag please call on 1033 and register your complaint.

data.query: What will happen to my FASTag if I relocate to another city?
data.solution: The FASTag will work at all the FASTag enabled toll plazas and you can travel seamlessly across the country without any change in the FASTag.

data.query: How should I upgrade my FASTag wallet to Full KYC?
data.solution:
You can upgrade your FASTag wallet to Full KYC using either of the following processes: Online Process:

1) To upgrade your KYC digitally, request the link by calling on 1860 2666 888 (local call charges applicable)
2) The link will be sent on your registered mobile number.
3) Simply follow the steps displayed during the process to update your KYC in FASTag wallet
4) PAN card, Aaadhaar card and a blank page with pen to be kept handy
Offline / Branch Process:

1) Visit any nearby branch with your PAN, identification document, address proof and passport size photograph. To locate a Branch near you click here
2) Ask for Customer Relationship Form from the branch staff
3) Submit the duly filled CRF with the documents
4) Branch will verify the form and process further
5) You will recieve an Email and SMS on the successful updation of KYC within 4 working days
Note:

1) Post successful upgradation in Full KYC, you can maintain balance of Rs.2,00,000/- per month in your FASTag wallet
2) The above mentioned process is applicable for individual customers only.

data.query: Can Kotak FASTag be used for making parking payments also?
data.solution: Presently, Kotak FASTag can be used for making parking payments at select locations. To know the parking location accepting FASTag for parking payments, click here

data.query: What are the benefits of using FASTag?
data.solution:
The following are the benefits of using a FASTag:

1) FASTag is an electronic toll collection system, operated by the NHAI. It consists of a sticker with RFID that gets read by the tag reader at the plaza and the toll amount gets deducted automatically for the linked wallet. This replaces cash transactions thus saving on time taken to exchange cash.

2) FASTag is now a mode of payment at select parking lots across the country. This results in quicker payments at parking lots.

data.query: What if I don't own a FASTag?
data.solution: Four-wheeled vehicles without an affixed FASTag will have to pay twice the toll amount at every toll plaza with a FASTag lane.

data.query: What are the features of using FASTag?
data.solution:
The following are the benefits of using a FASTag:

1) Recharge FASTag wallet through UPI/Credit Card /Debit Card/Net Banking, by logging into the Kotak FASTag portal at https://fastag.kotak.com/ or through UPI to
NETC.RegisteredVehicleNumber@KOTAK.
2) Receive SMS alerts for toll transactions, low balance, etc.
3) Tag validity for 5 Years 4) KYC customers can recharge maximum of Rs.2,00,000 whereas Non KYC customers can recharge for Rs.10,000
5) Wallet balance available on SMS by giving Missed Call on 18003157778 
6) FASTag transaction history can be viewed and downloaded from Kotak FASTag portal - https://fastag.kotak.com/

data.query: How do I get the FASTag for my vehicle?
data.solution:
You can apply for a FASTag through below channels:

1. Login to Mobile/Net Banking >> Apply Now >> Apply for FASTag
2. Kotak website - https://kotak.com/fastag >> Click on Apply now >> Proceed to enter details
3. Kotak Bank Branches For more details please click https://www.kotak.com/fastag

data.query: What if I get error while applying for FASTag online?
data.solution:
As per Prepaid Payment Instruments guidelines and Banks internal policy FASTag cannot be issued to:

1. Non Resident customers
2. Corporate and Authorised Signatories, Karta/HUF CRN cannot apply for FASTag through online journey. In case these customers wish to apply for a FASTag they will need to enter their Individual CRN at the time of registration
3. Minor customers
4. Customers with minimum KYC wallets through the online process unless the wallet is converted to a full KYC wallet
5. Customers having a Prepaid wallet / Small wallet / 811 OTP wallet with Kotak Bank

Please get in touch with our Customer Care Number at 1860 2666 888 (local call charges applicable) / 1800 3006 9090 Toll Free for further assistance.

data.query: If the vehicle is new & does not have registration certificate how can I apply for FASTag?
data.solution: In case registration certificate is not issued, you can still get FASTag basis VIN (Vehicle Identification Number) also known as Chassis Number. You can mention the Chassis number and apply for FASTag. Kindly note, for all the tags issued prior to 1st April, 2024 the vehicle number should be updated within 90 days of tag registration. For tag registration post 1st April, 2024 the vehicle number should be updated within 180 days of registration.

data.query: What are the charges for FASTag?
data.solution:
Total cost of a FASTag is Rs.300, which includes a onetime Issuance Fee of Rs.100 + GST, Rs.100 First time wallet load balance and Rs.100 security deposit which will be refundable at time of FASTag cancellation.

Please visit our website to know more.

data.query: Are there any other charges applicable like convenience fees etc.?
data.solution:
There may be additional charges associated with recharging the FASTag account through different channels. There is no convenience fee on recharge through UPI/Bill Pay.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Note: Convenience fee is levied against transaction processing fees

data.query: Do I need to use any specific lane at the toll plaza for FASTag?
data.solution: Yes, you need to use the lanes demarcated only for FASTag users. Only FASTag marked lanes have the required RFID infrastructure installed to read FASTag.

data.query: I have two vehicles, can I use one FASTag for two vehicles?
data.solution: You will need to take two separate FASTags for the two vehicles. You can mention both vehicle numbers at the time of FASTag application and get FASTag for both. In case you want to apply later for additional Tag for your 2nd/3rd vehicle, you can apply from Add Tag feature available on FASTag Customer Portal

data.query: Is FASTag working on all State Highway tolls?
data.solution:
FASTag can be used on all toll plazas where it has been implemented. You can check the list of FASTag enabled Plazas by clicking
https://www.kotak.com/en/personal-banking/cards/prepaid-card/fastag/active-toll-plazas.html

data.query: When & where will my FASTag be delivered?
data.solution:
Your FASTag will be delivered within 5 working days to the registered address updated with us.
Address of delivery :

1) For Existing customers: Communication address displayed on portal when applying for FASTag
2) For New to Bank Customers: Communication address entered by customer while applying for FASTag.
To track the delivery status of your FASTag, please get in touch with our Customer Care Numbers 1860 2666 888 (local call charges applicable) / 1800 3006 9090 Toll Free ( Car / Jeep / Van )

data.query: In case of any rejection of my application / delay in receiving FASTag - with whom I can touch base with?
data.solution:
Do not worry! Please report it to [email protected] or call on our Customer Care Numbers.

1) For Individual customers - please call on 1860 2666 888 (local call charges applicable) / 1800 3006 9090 (Toll Free) ( Car / Jeep / Van )
2) For Corporate customers - Please contact the Customer Care Number printed on your FASTag.

data.query: I reside within 10 km of a particular toll plaza. Do I need to take FASTag to get the concessions available for local vehicles?
data.solution: You will need to submit your documents to the concessionaire at local toll plaza for validating your residence within 10km of the particular plaza. Once it is verified, you may avail the concession on the FASTag assigned to your vehicle.

data.query: How to add/purchase a new tag in existing Kotak FASTag wallet?
data.solution:
You can add a new tag in your Kotak FASTag wallet via the following ways:
1) Login to Kotak FASTag portal: https://fastag.kotak.com with your registered mobile number, enter the captcha followed by OTP.
2) Click on "Add Tag" on the left hand side menu.
3) Select the Vehicle Class as "Car/Jeep/Van.
4) Select “Yes” & enter your Vehicle Registration Number (VRN). In case you don't have your VRN, click on "No" .and enter the Chassis Number; then click on Choose File to upload the invoice copy.

 5) Click on the tick box of Terms & Conditions and click on Submit to proceed for payment. 

 You can add up to 5 tags in your Kotak FASTag wallet. For requirement of additional tags (above 5), visit your nearest Kotak Mahindra Bank branch.
                                                       OR
Call 1860 266 6888 (local charges apply) to purchase additional tags in your existing Kotak FASTag wallet.

data.query: How do I know whether my FASTag is active or not?
data.solution:
The FASTag issued by Bank is pre-activated and loaded with the amount paid by the customer at the time of purchase of the Tag. To check the status of your Tag, login to Kotak FASTag Portal - https://fastag.kotak.com with your User Id.

1) If your Tag status is 'Low Balance', please recharge your FASTag. To know about Recharge options, visit www.kotak.com/fastag and click on 'How to Recharge' tab

2) If your FASTag status is 'Low Balance' due to non Usage for more than 12 months, you can do either of the follow:
         a) You can activate your FASTag with a Recharge
         b) E-mail a Tag Reactivation request to [email protected]
         c) Visit https://fastag.kotak.com/SR/#/ and click on "Reactivate" tab

3) If your Tag status is Low Balance due to 'Vehicle Number not updated', then your Vehicle Registration Details are required to be updated in our system. Please login to the Kotak FASTag portal and update details.

4) If your FASTag is active but not transacting at a particular toll plaza, please get in touch with IHMCL toll free number 1033 for assistance.

data.query: When can my FASTag be in Low Balance status?
data.solution:
To check the status of your Tag, login to the Kotak FASTag Portal - https://fastag.kotak.com with your User Id.

Following are the reasons a FASTag can be in 'Low Balance' status:

1) A threshold /minimum amount is assigned to the FASTag wallet and if the balance goes below the assigned amount, the tag wallet goes into 'Low balance' status.

2) If your Tag status is 'Low Balance' due to Non Usage for more than 12 months
     a) You can activate your FASTag with a Recharge
     b) E-mail a Tag Reactivation request to [email protected]
     c) Visit fastag.kotak.com and click on "Reactivate" tab

3) If your Tag status is 'Low Balance' due to 'Vehicle Number not updated', the Vehicle Registration Details are not updated in our system. Please login to Kotak FASTag portal and update details.

4) If your FASTag is active but not transacting at a particular toll plaza, please get in touch with IHMCL toll free number 1033 for assistance.
A FASTag with low balance will not transact at the toll plaza, hence you need to Recharge your Kotak FASTag wallet.
Click here to know the Recharges options

data.query: Why am I not able to pass through Toll Plaza?
data.solution:
Sorry that you faced this issue! The FASTag will not transact at Toll plaza under the following circumstances:
1) If your FASTag status is in 'Low Balance ', please recharge your FASTag. Click here to know more about the Recharge options 

2) If your Tag status is 'Low Balance' due to Non Usage for more than 12 months
     a) You can activate your FASTag with a Recharge
     b) E-mail a Tag Reactivation request to [email protected]
     c) Visit fastag.kotak.com and click on "Reactivate" tab

3) If your Tag status is 'Low Balance' due to 'Vehicle Number not updated', the Vehicle Registration Details are not updated in our system. Please login to Kotak FASTag portal and update details.

4) If your FASTag is damaged, login to Kotak FASTag portal with your User Id and submit the request for replacement.

5) If your FASTag is active but not transacting at a particular toll plaza, please get in touch with IHMCL toll free number 1033 for assistance.
A FASTag with low balance will not transact at the toll plaza, hence you need to Recharge your Kotak FASTag wallet.
Click here to know the Recharges options

data.query: I have received my FASTag however why is it not activated?
data.solution:
The FASTag issued by Bank is pre-activated and loaded with amount paid by customer at the time of purchase. To check the status of your Tag, please login to Kotak FASTag Portal with your User Id .
OR
Contact Customer Care at 1860 2666 888 (local call charges applicable) / 1800 3006 9090 Toll Free

data.query: How should I upgrade my FASTag wallet to Full KYC?
data.solution:
You can upgrade your FASTag wallet to Full KYC using either of the following processes: 

Online Process:

1) To upgrade your KYC digitally, request the link by calling on 1860 2666 888 (local call charges applicable)
2) The link will be sent on your registered mobile number.
3) Simply follow the steps displayed during the process to update your KYC in FASTag wallet
4) PAN card, Aaadhaar card and a blank page with pen to be kept handy
Offline / Branch Process:

1) Visit any nearby branch with your PAN, identification document, address proof and passport size photograph. To locate a Branch near you click here
2) Ask for Customer Relationship Form from the branch staff
3) Submit the duly filled CRF with the documents
4) Branch will verify the form and process further
5) You will recieve an Email and SMS on the successful updation of KYC within 4 working days
Note:

1) Post successful upgradation in Full KYC, you can maintain balance of Rs.2,00,000/- per month in your FASTag wallet
2) The above mentioned process is applicable for individual customers only.

data.query: How should I locate my nearby branch?
data.solution: To locate your nearest branch, click here

data.query: What if the FASTag is not read at the toll plaza?
data.solution:
The following are possible scenarios and their solutions, in case the FASTag is not read at the toll plaza:

1. The tag reader of the plaza might not be working. in such a scenario, you may pay the toll charges in cash.

2. The tag might not be pasted correctly on the vehicle or not readable by the reader at the toll plaza, wherein the other vehicle tags are easily being read by the toll plaza:
   a) You may request the toll plaza officer to use the hand held device to read the tag
   b) You may pay the toll in cash

3. The tag may be in damaged state; to request for a replacement tag, log on Kotak FASTag Portal

To check the status of your FASTag, login to Kotak FASTag Portal https://fastag.kotak.com/ with your User Id .

data.query: In case of harassment/ misconduct/ discourteous/ rude behaviour of toll collection staff, what should we do?
data.solution: In case of such a scenario, a complaint is to be lodged with respective Project Directors at the toll plaza. Further, the incident may be reported at [email protected]  or call on toll free number 1033

data.query: On which number will I receive the SMS alerts regarding FASTag transactions?
data.solution:
FASTag transactions alerts are sent by a SMS on the Mobile number registered while applying for FASTag.

In case you wish to edit or change the Mobile number for FASTag then please write to us at [email protected] with KYC document and dully filled and signed FASTag Maintenance Form.

Click here to download the form 

OR

You can register the request by visiting Kotak FASTag Portal  >>

Click On Complaint >> New complaint >> General Complaint >> Request >> Request for change/update in Mobile Number/Email Id. Upload the dully filled and signed FASTag Maintenance Form and KYC documents in attachment option.

data.query: Why did I not receive an SMS alert after paying for FASTag?
data.solution:
1. The Mobile network could be weak at your location

2. The Mobile number Registered with the FASTag wallet could be different. To check the Registered Mobile Number, please visit Kotak FASTag portal https://fastag.kotak.com If the Mobile number is correct, please report to [email protected] or call on our Customer Care Number.
In case you wish to change / update mobile number / email ID in your FASTag wallet, simply follow these steps:

1) Register the request by visit Kotak FASTag Portal https://fastag.kotak.com >>
Click On Complaint >> New complaint >> General Complaint >> Request >> Request for change/update in Mobile Number/Email Id. Upload the dully filled and signed FASTag Maintainanence Form with KYC documents in attachment section.

2) Write to us at [email protected] with attached valid KYC documents and dully filled and signed FASTag Maintainanence Form.
Please click here to access Maintenance Form

data.query: How would I know that the correct user fee has been deducted from my FASTag wallet?
data.solution:
For every transaction at a toll plaza, you will receive an SMS alert on your registered mobile number about the balance deducted from your FASTag wallet.

There are 3 ways to check your FASTag wallet balance:

1) Give a miss call to 7406575500 from your registered mobile number
2) Login to the Kotak FASTag Customer Portal with your User Id to check balance
3) Call our Customer Care Number 1800 3006 9090 to know the balance
Note - The wallet balance can be used by all the vehicles linked to the wallet.

data.query: How would I report an incorrect/double deduction and how will I get back the same?
data.solution:
You can report incorrect deduction through the FASTag Customer Portal, log in to the Kotak FASTag portal https://fastag.kotak.com/ > Go to Complaint Tab > Select Transaction Related Complaint. 
Disputed amount of up to Rs.1,000 will be refunded back within 2 working days. Also a refund request will be raised, in case the amount is claimed by the acquiring bank later. In such a scenario the amount will be debited again from your wallet. 
OR
Email us on [email protected] with the dispute details along with the RC copy (should be clearly legible) of your vehicle, vehicle image or  any supporting document for dispute.

Note -

1) refund request should be raised within 35 days from the date of transaction, the dispute need to be raised with the necessary documents (Clearly visible scan copy of RC and Vehicle image). The refund request settlement timeline is 20 days.
2) If the refund request is raised after 35 days from the day of transaction, the dispute will be raised in good faith basis.

data.query: How would I pay if the ETC equipment at Toll plaza are not working?
data.solution: In case ETC equipment is not working and your FASTag account is having sufficient balance, please pay the toll fee in cash at the plaza. Additionally, please call on 1033 toll-free number and register the complaint on centralize call center set up by NHAI (Gov. of India) about the issue at the toll plaza.

data.query: I have FASTag and also balance amount, but I could not go through ETC lane. How do I get my FASTag checked whether balance is deducted or not?
data.solution:
For every transaction at a toll plaza, you will receive an SMS alert on your registered mobile number about the balance deducted from your FASTag wallet.

There are 2 ways to check your FASTag wallet balance:

1) Give a missed call to 7406575500 from your registered mobile number
2) Login to the Kotak FASTag Portal https://fastag.kotak.com with your User Id and check the last transaction

data.query: How I will find out if my wallet is debited for toll transactions?
data.solution:
An SMS will be sent on your registered mobile number for each transaction that is deducted from your FASTag wallet.

To check your FASTag wallet balance:

1. Give a miss call to 7406575500 from your registered mobile Or
2. Login to Kotak FASTag portal https://fastag.kotak.com/ with your User Id to check your wallet balance and transaction details. Or
3. Call Customer Care Number to know your balance and transaction details.

Note - The wallet balance can be used by all vehicles linked to the wallet.

data.query: How can I avail a monthly pass for FASTag?
data.solution: The monthly pass facility is specific to each toll plaza. You can avail Monthly Pass Facility on NHAI website.

data.query: What if the Toll Transaction amount is paid through Cash still the transaction is debited from my FASTAG wallet?
data.solution:
You can report incorrect deduction through the FASTag Customer Portal, log in to the Kotak FASTag portal https://fastag.kotak.com/ > Go to Complaint Tab > Select Transaction Related Complaint.

Disputed amount of up to Rs.1,000 will be refunded back within 2 working days. Also a refund request will be raised, in case the amount is claimed by the acquiring bank later. In such a scenario the amount will be debited again from your wallet.

OR

Email us on [email protected] with the dispute details along with the RC copy (should be clearly legible) of your vehicle, vehicle image or any supporting document for dispute.
 
Note - 
1) refund request should be raised within 35 days from the date of transaction, the dispute need to be raised with the necessary documents (Clearly visible scan copy of RC and Vehicle image). The refund request settlement timeline is 20 days.
2) If the refund request is raised after 35 days from the day of transaction, the dispute will be raised in good faith basis.

data.query: Is there any minimum or maximum value for such recharge/top up?
data.solution:
You can Recharge your FASTag from Rs.100 onwards.

Maximum amount of recharge depends on the type of Vehicle and wallet linked to the FASTag.

A Full KYC customer can recharge to a maximum of Rs.2,00,000 (per month) whereas a Minimum or Non KYC customer can recharge for Rs.10,000 (per month)

data.query: My FASTag recharge got failed, but amount got deducted from my wallet, what to do?
data.solution:
Do not worry! If transaction has failed or is unsuccessful or timed out, the disputed amount will be auto refunded to the origin account within 2- 3 working days. If amount is not refunded, please report it to [email protected] enclosing the information:


Mobile Number
Recharge Amount
Date of Transaction
Bank Name
Account Number
Transaction Reference Number (UTR, RRN, UPI Txn Ref no.)
Mode Of Transaction (Customer Portal – CC/DC/UPI/NB, Phone pay, Gpay).


OR

You can register the complaint by visiting Kotak FASTag Portal https://fastag.kotak.com >>

Click On Complaint >> New complaint >> General Complaint >> Complaint >> Amount is Debited but recharge has not happened. Mention the above transaction details in the complaint description.

data.query: What is my UPI ID for reloading of FASTag?
data.solution:
Your UPI ID of FASTag is NETC.VehicleRegistrationNumber@kotak . 

For e.g. Vehicle Registration number is MH04BB1234 and issuer bank is Kotak Bank then UPI ID will be netc.MH04BB1234@Kotak.

1) You should get the UPI ID validated with your bank before recharging FASTag through UPI. Recharge can be done through UPI/ Internet Banking/ Credit Card/ Debit Card by logging into the FASTag Customer Portal.

2) Just login to the portal https://fastag.kotak.com/ using the credentials and load fund from any of the source mentioned above to your FASTag account. Or do a UPI to netc.RegisteredVehicleNumber@kotak from any UPI app like Google Pay/ PhonePe/ Amazon/ Kotak Bank Mobile App etc.

data.query: How do I activate auto debit facility from my bank account for FASTag?
data.solution:
Your Kotak FASTag wallet can be set for an Auto-Recharge with a pre-defined amount from your Kotak Bank Savings Account only.

Here's your quick guide to enable Auto Recharge for FASTag on Kotak Mobile Banking App:

1) Log on to Kotak Mobile Banking App, click on FASTag under Cards Section
2) Click on Enable Auto Recharge
3) Enter the Auto Recharge Amount
4) Click on Continue to Generate OTP
5) Enter the OTP & select the linked Kotak A/C, review the details and confirm
Your FASTag wallet will be recharged as soon balance reaches threshold amount.
Below are steps to enable Auto Recharge on customer portal: https://fastag.kotak.com:
1) Log on to customer portal, enter registered mobile number, enter captcha followed by OTP
2) Click on Auto Recharge section (Left menu) and toggle Right to enable the feature
3) Click on Edit Auto Top-Up Amount & confirm with OTP sent to your registered mobile number.
4) Enter Auto Top-Up Amount & select linked Kotak A/c from which the Auto-Recharge amount would be Debited and Confirm.

data.query: Can I transfer balance from one FASTag wallet to another?
data.solution: Wallet to wallet transfer is not allowed.

data.query: How can I check my FASTag balance?
data.solution:
Oh, that is simple! To check your balance in FASTag wallet you may refer the steps below:

1) Give a miss call to 18003157778 from your registered mobile number Or

2) Login to Kotak FASTag Portal https://fastag.kotak.com/ with your User Id

A SMS alert is sent on registered mobile number, each time balance is deducted from your FASTag wallet.


Note : The wallet balance can be used by any vehicle linked to the wallet.
.

data.query: How can I check the KYC status of my FASTag wallet?
data.solution:
Steps to know the KYC status of your FASTAG wallet:

1) Visit Kotak FASTag portal - https://fastag.kotak.com
2) Log in with user ID - Registered Mobile Number and Password
3) Click on "My Profile" in Menu section
4) Click on "KYC Tab" to know the KYC status of your FASTag wallet

OR

4) View "Monthly Limit" tab in "Account Summary" :
     a) If the wallet balance monthly limit is Rs.10,000 it is a minimum KYC;
     b) if the wallet balance monthly limit is Rs.2,00,000 it has been upgraded to Full KYC wallet

data.query: What are the benefits of updating KYC in FASTag wallet?
data.solution: Once you update your FASTag wallet to Full KYC, the wallet balance limit will increase to Rs.2,00,000/- per month from Rs.10,000/- per month.

data.query: How to recharge/reload my wallet & How much time does it take to reflect the amount in my FASTag wallet?
data.solution:
FASTag can be Recharged easily through UPI/Internet banking/credit card/debit card using the Kotak FASTag Portal. The amount will reflect in your FASTag wallet instantly.
For more details visit our website

data.query: How do I update my Vehicle Number in the system for Fastag?
data.solution:
Steps to update your Vehicle Registration No.:
1. Login to Kotak FASTag portal - https://www.fastag.kotak.com
2. Click on “Vehicle Number Update” tab on the left hand side menu.
3. Upload Registration Copy in PDF file (size should be less than 5MB) and Vehicle Image, click on Submit.
Within 3 working days your Vehicle Registration Number (VRN) will be updated.
In case you face any issue while uploading details on Kotak FASTag portal please write to [email protected] from your registered email id along with dully filled and signed FASTag Maintenance Form. Attach scanned copy of your PAN card and Registration copy.
Click here for Maintenance Form

data.query: What if the Tag received is damaged how can I replace the tag?
data.solution:
You can submit a FASTag replacement request by following the steps below:

1. Login to the Kotak FASTag portal
2. Enter User ID - Registered Mobile Number and Password
3. Click On Complaint >> New complaint >> General Complaint >> Complaint >> Damaged/Missing Tag in courier packet received. Mention Reason for replacement.

OR

Send mail to [email protected] from your registered mail id for replacement of the FASTag.

OR

You may call our Customer Care Numbers to register the request.


Note - Your tag will be replaced within two working days. Your wallet balance will remain the same post replacement, the new tag will be linked to your existing wallet.

data.query: What is the meaning of Blacklisted FASTag?
data.solution:
A vehicle with a 'blacklisted FASTag is not allowed to pay toll using FASTag at the toll plaza.

There are various reasons of blacklisting of a FASTag

1) Insufficient / Negative Balance - The FASTag wallet is not having sufficient balance or running in negative balance.
To activate a blacklisted FASTag, Recharge at the earliest. Click here to know the recharge options. If the problem is not solved, please contact the Call Centre number to know the reason of blacklist.

2) FASTag can also be blacklisted by the law enforcement agencies due to any rule violation / complaint register against the vehicle. In such cases the enforcement agencies request issuer or acquirer to add the tag id the in the blacklist.
